Initializes @fd. Alternatively you can initialize it with #GST_POLL_FD_INIT.
Since: 0.10.18

function.name: gst_byte_reader_peek_data
function.description: Returns: %TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #guint8 to store the result

function.return:
%TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.
Since: 0.10.22

function.name: gst_object_suggest_next_sync
function.description: Convenience function for GObject

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that has controlled properties

function.return: same thing as gst_controller_suggest_next_sync() Since: 0.10.13

function.name: gst_check_caps_equal
function.description:
Compare two caps with gst_caps_is_equal and fail unless they are equal.
Since: 0.10.18

function.name: gst_sdp_media_get_proto
function.description: Get the transport protocol of @media
function.return: the transport protocol of @media.

function.name: gst_object_default_error
function.description:
A default error function.
The default handler will simply print the error string using g_print.

parameter.name: debug
parameter.parameter_description: an additional debug information string, or NULL.

function.name: gst_parse_launchv
function.return: a new element on success and %NULL on failure.

function.name: gst_tag_list_remove_tag
function.description: Removes the given tag from the taglist.

function.name: gst_element_get_factory
function.description: Retrieves the factory that was used to create this element.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to request the element factory of.

function.return: the #GstElementFactory used for creating this element. no refcounting is needed.

function.name: gst_controller_set_property_disabled
function.description:
This function is used to disable the #GstController on a property for some time, i.e. gst_controller_sync_values() will do nothing for the property.
Since: 0.10.14

parameter.name: disabled
parameter.parameter_description: boolean that specifies whether to disable the controller or not.

function.name: gst_fft_f64_free
function.description: This frees the memory allocated for @self.

function.name: gst_tag_list_merge
function.description: Merges the two given lists into a new list. If one of the lists is NULL, a copy of the other is returned. If both lists are NULL, NULL is returned.
function.return: the new list

function.name: gst_pad_get_allowed_caps
function.description:
Gets the capabilities of the allowed media types that can flow through @pad and its peer.
The allowed capabilities is calculated as the intersection of the results of calling gst_pad_get_caps() on @pad and its peer. The caller owns a reference on the resulting caps.
function.return:
the allowed #GstCaps of the pad link. Unref the caps when you no longer need it. This function returns NULL when @pad has no peer.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_poll_set_flushing
function.description:
When @flushing is %TRUE, this function ensures that current and future calls to gst_poll_wait() will return -1, with errno set to EBUSY.
Unsetting the flushing state will restore normal operation of @set.
Since: 0.10.18

function.name: gst_rtsp_find_header_field
function.description: Convert @header to a #GstRTSPHeaderField.
function.return: a #GstRTSPHeaderField for @header or #GST_RTSP_HDR_INVALID if the header field is unknown.

function.name: gst_buffer_join
function.description:
Create a new buffer that is the concatenation of the two source buffers, and unrefs the original source buffers.
If the buffers point to contiguous areas of memory, the buffer is created without copying the data.
This is a convenience function for C programmers. See also gst_buffer_merge(), which does the same thing without unreffing the input parameters. Language bindings without explicit reference counting should not wrap this function.
function.return: the new #GstBuffer which is the concatenation of the source buffers.

function.name: gst_poll_read_control
function.description: Read a byte from the control socket of the controllable @set. This function is mostly usefull for timer #GstPoll objects created with gst_poll_new_timer().
function.return:
%TRUE on success. %FALSE when @set is not controllable or when there was no byte to read.
Since: 0.10.23

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_poll

parameter.name: events
parameter.parameter_description: a bitmask of #GstRTSPEvent flags to check

function.return:
#GST_RTSP_OK on success.
Since: 0.10.15

function.name: gst_registry_fork_is_enabled
function.description:
By default GStreamer will perform a fork() when scanning and rebuilding the registry file.
Applications might want to disable this behaviour with the gst_registry_fork_set_enabled() function.
function.return:
%TRUE if GStreamer will use fork() when rebuilding the registry. On platforms without fork(), this function will always return %FALSE.
Since: 0.10.10

function.name: gst_type_find_suggest_simple
function.description:
If a #GstTypeFindFunction calls this function it suggests the caps with the given probability. A #GstTypeFindFunction may supply different suggestions in one call. It is up to the caller of the #GstTypeFindFunction to interpret these values.
This function is similar to gst_type_find_suggest(), only that instead of passing a #GstCaps argument you can create the caps on the fly in the same way as you can with gst_caps_new_simple().
Make sure you terminate the list of arguments with a NULL argument and that the values passed have the correct type (in terms of width in bytes when passed to the vararg function - this applies particularly to gdouble and guint64 arguments).
Since: 0.10.20

parameter.name: find
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstTypeFind object the function was called with

parameter.name: probability
parameter.parameter_description: The probability in percent that the suggestion is right

parameter.name: media_type
parameter.parameter_description: the media type of the suggested caps

parameter.name: fieldname
parameter.parameter_description: first field of the suggested caps, or NULL

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: additional arguments to the suggested caps in the same format as the arguments passed to gst_structure_new() (ie. triplets of field name, field GType and field value)

function.name: gst_caps_is_subset
function.description: Checks if all caps represented by @subset are also represented by @superset. <note>This function does not work reliably if optional properties for caps are included on one caps and omitted on the other.</note>
function.return: %TRUE if @subset is a subset of @superset

function.name: gst_caps_replace
function.description:
Replaces *caps with @newcaps. Unrefs the #GstCaps in the location pointed to by @caps, if applicable, then modifies @caps to point to @newcaps. An additional ref on @newcaps is taken.
This function does not take any locks so you might want to lock the object owning @caps pointer.

function.name: gst_buffer_new
function.description:
Creates a newly allocated buffer without any data.
MT safe.
function.return: the new #GstBuffer.

function.name: gst_bin_iterate_all_by_interface
function.description:
Looks for all elements inside the bin that implements the given interface. You can safely cast all returned elements to the given interface. The function recurses inside child bins. The iterator will yield a series of #GstElement that should be unreffed after use.
Each element yielded by the iterator will have its refcount increased, so unref after use.
MT safe. Caller owns returned value.
function.return: a #GstIterator of #GstElement for all elements in the bin implementing the given interface, or NULL

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_csrc
function.description: Get the CSRC at index @idx in @buffer.

parameter.name: idx
parameter.parameter_description: the index of the CSRC to get

function.return: the CSRC at index @idx in host order.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_get_bits_uint8
function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val and update the current position.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #guint8 to store the result

function.return:
%TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.
Since: 0.10.22

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_get_header
function.description: Get the @indx header value with key @field from @msg. The result in @value stays valid as long as it remains present in @msg.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK when @field was found, #GST_RTSP_ENOTIMPL if the key was not found.

function.name: gst_sdp_media_new
function.description: Allocate a new GstSDPMedia and store the result in @media.
function.return: a #GstSDPResult.

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_set_auth_param
function.description:
Setup @conn with authentication directives. This is not necesary for methods #GST_RTSP_AUTH_NONE and #GST_RTSP_AUTH_BASIC. For #GST_RTSP_AUTH_DIGEST, directives should be taken from the digest challenge in the WWW-Authenticate response header and can include realm, domain, nonce, opaque, stale, algorithm, qop as per RFC2617.
Since: 0.10.20

function.name: gst_adapter_peek
function.description:
Gets the first @size bytes stored in the @adapter. The returned pointer is valid until the next function is called on the adapter.
Note that setting the returned pointer as the data of a #GstBuffer is incorrect for general-purpose plugins. The reason is that if a downstream element stores the buffer so that it has access to it outside of the bounds of its chain function, the buffer will have an invalid data pointer after your element flushes the bytes. In that case you should use gst_adapter_take(), which returns a freshly-allocated buffer that you can set as #GstBuffer malloc_data or the potentially more performant gst_adapter_take_buffer().
Returns: a pointer to the first @size bytes of data, or NULL.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to peek

function.return: a pointer to the first @size bytes of data, or NULL.

function.name: gst_alloc_trace_set_flags
function.description: Enable the given features on the given GstAllocTrace object.

function.name: gst_element_continue_state
function.description:
Commit the state change of the element and proceed to the next pending state if any. This function is used by elements that do asynchronous state changes. The core will normally call this method automatically when an element returned %GST_STATE_CHANGE_SUCCESS from the state change function.
If after calling this method the element still has not reached the pending state, the next state change is performed.
This method is used internally and should normally not be called by plugins or applications.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to continue the state change of.

function.return:
The result of the commit state change.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_control_source_get_value_array
function.description:
Gets an array of values for one element property.
All fields of @value_array must be filled correctly. Especially the @value_array->values array must be big enough to keep the requested amount of values.
The type of the values in the array is the same as the property's type.

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the time that should be processed

function.return: %TRUE if the given array could be filled, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gst_controller_new_valist
function.description: Creates a new GstController for the given object's properties

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object of which some properties should be controlled

parameter.name: var_args
parameter.parameter_description: %NULL terminated list of property names that should be controlled

function.return: the new controller.

function.name: gst_audio_default_registry_mixer_filter
function.description:
Utility function to find audio mixer elements.
Will traverse the default plugin registry in order of plugin rank and find usable audio mixer elements. The caller may optionally fine-tune the selection by specifying a filter function.

parameter.name: first
parameter.parameter_description: set to #TRUE if you only want the first suitable mixer element

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data to pass to the filter function

function.return:
a #GList of audio mixer #GstElement<!-- -->s. You must free each element in the list by setting it to NULL state and calling gst_object_unref(). After that the list itself should be freed using g_list_free().
Since: 0.10.2

function.name: gst_element_class_get_pad_template
function.description: Retrieves a padtemplate from @element_class with the given name. <note>If you use this function in the #GInstanceInitFunc of an object class that has subclasses, make sure to pass the g_class parameter of the #GInstanceInitFunc here.</note>

parameter.name: element_class
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElementClass to get the pad template of.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the #GstPadTemplate to get.

function.return: the #GstPadTemplate with the given name, or %NULL if none was found. No unreferencing is necessary.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_peek_int16_be

parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #gint16 to store the result

function.return:
%TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_segtrap_set_enabled

Applications might want to disable/enable the SIGSEGV handling of the GStreamer core. See gst_segtrap_is_enabled() for more information.
Since: 0.10.10

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.parameter_description: whether a custom SIGSEGV handler should be installed.

Creates a GDP packet from the given caps.

function.name: gst_message_new_structure_change
function.description:
Create a new structure change message. This message is posted when the structure of a pipeline is in the process of being changed, for example when pads are linked or unlinked.
@src should be the srcpad that unlinked or linked.

parameter.name: busy
parameter.parameter_description: Whether the structure change is busy.

function.return:
The new structure change message.
MT safe.
Since: 0.10.22.

function.name: gst_pipeline_set_delay
function.description:
Set the expected delay needed for all elements to perform the PAUSED to PLAYING state change. @delay will be added to the base time of the elements so that they wait an additional @delay amount of time before starting to process buffers and cannot be #GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE.
This option is used for tuning purposes and should normally not be used.
MT safe.
Since: 0.10.5

parameter.name: freqdata

%TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_base_src_set_format
function.description:
Sets the default format of the source. This will be the format used for sending NEW_SEGMENT events and for performing seeks.
If a format of GST_FORMAT_BYTES is set, the element will be able to operate in pull mode if the #GstBaseSrc::is_seekable returns TRUE.
Since: 0.10.1

function.name: gst_value_take_mini_object
gst_byte_reader_peek_uint32_le

function.return:
%TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.
Since: 0.10.22

function.name: gst_message_parse_tag
function.description:
Extracts the tag list from the GstMessage. The tag list returned in the output argument is a copy; the caller must free it when done.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_get_pad
function.description:
Retrieves a pad from @element by name. Tries gst_element_get_static_pad() first, then gst_element_get_request_pad().
Deprecated: This function is deprecated as it's unclear if the reference to the result pad should be released with gst_object_unref() in case of a static pad or gst_element_release_request_pad() in case of a request pad. Use gst_element_get_static_pad() or gst_element_get_request_pad() instead.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the pad to retrieve.

function.return: the #GstPad if found, otherwise %NULL. Unref or Release after usage, depending on the type of the pad.

function.name: gst_base_src_wait_playing
function.description:
If the #GstBaseSrcClass::create method performs its own synchronisation against the clock it must unblock when going from PLAYING to the PAUSED state and call this method before continuing to produce the remaining data.
This function will block until a state change to PLAYING happens (in which case this function returns #GST_FLOW_OK) or the processing must be stopped due to a state change to READY or a FLUSH event (in which case this function Returns: #GST_FLOW_OK if @src is PLAYING and processing can
function.return: #GST_FLOW_OK if @src is PLAYING and processing can continue. Any other return value should be returned from the create vmethod.

function.name: gst_mixer_options_get_values
function.description: Get the values for the mixer option.

parameter.parameter_description: The #GstMixerOptions item that owns the values.

function.return: A list of strings with all the possible values for the mixer option. You must not free or modify the list or its contents, it belongs to the @mixer_options object.

function.name: gst_structure_get_field_type
function.description: Finds the field with the given name, and returns the type of the value it contains. If the field is not found, G_TYPE_INVALID is returned.
function.return: the #GValue of the field

function.name: gst_caps_merge
function.description:
Appends the structures contained in @caps2 to @caps1 if they are not yet expressed by @caps1. The structures in @caps2 are not copied -- they are transferred to @caps1, and then @caps2 is freed. If either caps is ANY, the resulting caps will be ANY.
Since: 0.10.10

parameter.name: caps1
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstCaps that will take the new entries

function.name: gst_mixer_set_record
function.description: Enables or disables recording on the given track. Note that this is only possible on input tracks, not on output tracks (see GST_MIXER_TRACK_HAS_FLAG () and the GST_MIXER_TRACK_INPUT flag).

parameter.name: record
parameter.parameter_description: a boolean value that indicates whether to turn on or off recording.

function.name: gst_tag_to_vorbis_comments

parameter.name: tag
parameter.parameter_description: a GStreamer tag identifier, such as #GST_TAG_ARTIST

function.return: A #GList of newly-allowcated key=value strings. Free with g_list_foreach (list, (GFunc) g_free, NULL) plus g_list_free (list)

function.name: escape_string

function.name: gst_registry_get_default
function.description: Retrieves the default registry. The caller does not own a reference on the registry, as it is alive as long as GStreamer is initialized.
function.return: The default #GstRegistry.

function.return: a #GList of #GstPluginFeature. Use gst_plugin_feature_list_free() after usage.

function.return: #GST_SDP_OK.

function.return: the message type.

Create a new ghostpad with @target as the target. The direction will be taken from the target pad. The template used on the ghostpad will be @template.
Will ref the target.

parameter.name: templ
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPadTemplate to use on the ghostpad.

function.return:
a new #GstPad, or NULL in case of an error.
Since: 0.10.10

%TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_audio_clock_new
function.description: Create a new #GstAudioClock instance. Whenever the clock time should be calculated it will call @func with @user_data. When @func returns #GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE, the clock will return the last reported time.
function.return: a new #GstAudioClock casted to a #GstClock.

function.name: gst_poll_remove_fd

%TRUE if the file descriptor was successfully removed from the set.

function.name: gst_message_new_clock_lost
function.description:
Create a clock lost message. This message is posted whenever the clock is not valid anymore.
If this message is posted by the pipeline, the pipeline will select a new clock again when it goes to PLAYING. It might therefore be needed to set the pipeline to PAUSED and PLAYING again.
function.return:
The new clock lost message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_sdp_message_add_time
function.description: Add time information @start and @stop to @msg.
function.return: a #GstSDPResult.

function.name: gst_value_set_int_range
function.description: Sets @value to the range specified by @start and @end.

function.name: gst_caps_is_empty
function.description: Determines if @caps represents no media formats.
function.return: TRUE if @caps represents no formats.

function.name: gst_video_format_get_pixel_stride
function.description:
Calculates the pixel stride (number of bytes from one pixel to the pixel to its immediate left) for the video component with an index of @component. See @gst_video_format_get_row_stride for a description of the component index.
Since: 0.10.16
function.return: pixel stride of component @component

function.name: gst_structure_new
function.description: Creates a new #GstStructure with the given name. Parses the list of variable arguments and sets fields to the values listed. Variable arguments should be passed as field name, field type, and value. Last variable argument should be NULL.

parameter.name: firstfield
parameter.parameter_description: name of first field to set

function.return: a new #GstStructure

function.name: gst_iterator_next
function.description:
Get the next item from the iterator in @elem.
Only when this function returns %GST_ITERATOR_OK, @elem will contain a valid value. For iterators that return refcounted objects, the returned object will have its refcount increased and should therefore be unreffed after usage.
When this function returns %GST_ITERATOR_DONE, no more elements can be retrieved from @it.
A return value of %GST_ITERATOR_RESYNC indicates that the element list was concurrently updated. The user of @it should call gst_iterator_resync() to get the newly updated list.
A return value of %GST_ITERATOR_ERROR indicates an unrecoverable fatal error.
function.return:
The result of the iteration. Unref @elem after usage if this is a refcounted object.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_value_set_caps
function.description: Sets the contents of @value to @caps. The actual #GstCaps structure is copied before it is used.

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: the caps to set the value to

function.name: gst_collect_pads_remove_pad
function.description:
Remove a pad from the collection of collect pads. This function will also free the #GstCollectData and all the resources that were allocated with gst_collect_pads_add_pad().
The pad will be deactivated automatically when @pads is stopped.
function.return:
%TRUE if the pad could be removed.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_add_header
function.description: Add a header with key @field and @value to @msg. This function takes a copy of @value.
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_pad_set_blocked_async
function.description:
Blocks or unblocks the dataflow on a pad. The provided callback is called when the operation succeeds; this happens right before the next attempt at pushing a buffer on the pad.
This can take a while as the pad can only become blocked when real dataflow is happening. When the pipeline is stalled, for example in PAUSED, this can take an indeterminate amount of time. You can pass NULL as the callback to make this call block. Be careful with this blocking call as it might not return for reasons stated above.

parameter.name: blocked
parameter.parameter_description: boolean indicating whether the pad should be blocked or unblocked

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: #GstPadBlockCallback that will be called when the operation succeeds

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data passed to the callback

function.return:
TRUE if the pad could be blocked. This function can fail if the wrong parameters were passed or the pad was already in the requested state.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_index_entry_assoc_map
function.description: Gets alternative formats associated with the indexentry.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: the format of the value the find

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to store the value

function.return: TRUE if there was a value associated with the given format.

function.name: gst_alloc_trace_list
function.description: Get a list of all registered alloc trace objects.
function.return: a GList of GstAllocTrace objects.

function.name: gst_element_class_add_pad_template
function.description: Adds a padtemplate to an element class. This is mainly used in the _base_init functions of classes.

parameter.name: klass
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstElementClass to add the pad template to.

parameter.name: templ
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPadTemplate to add to the element class.

function.name: gst_tuner_get_frequency
function.description: Retrieve the current frequency from the given channel. As for gst_tuner_set_frequency(), the #GstTunerChannel must support frequency operations, as indicated by the GST_TUNER_CHANNEL_FREQUENCY flag.

parameter.name: tuner
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstTuner (a #GstElement) that owns the given channel.

parameter.name: channel
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstTunerChannel to retrieve the frequency from.

function.return: The current frequency, or 0 on error.

function.name: gst_index_commit
function.description: Tell the index that the writer with the given id is done with this index and is not going to write any more entries to it.

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: the writer that commited the index

function.name: gst_bin_iterate_recurse
function.description:
Gets an iterator for the elements in this bin. This iterator recurses into GstBin children.
Each element yielded by the iterator will have its refcount increased, so unref after use.
MT safe. Caller owns returned value.
function.return: a #GstIterator of #GstElement, or NULL

function.name: gst_plugin_feature_check_version
function.description: Checks whether the given plugin feature is at least the required version
function.return: #TRUE if the plugin feature has at least the required version, otherwise #FALSE.

function.name: gst_index_new_group
function.description: Create a new group for the given index. It will be set as the current group.

parameter.name: index
parameter.parameter_description: the index to create the new group in

function.return: the id of the newly created group.

function.name: gst_element_set_clock
function.description: Sets the clock for the element. This function increases the refcount on the clock. Any previously set clock on the object is unreffed.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to set the clock for.

parameter.name: clock
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstClock to set for the element.

function.return:
%TRUE if the element accepted the clock. An element can refuse a clock when it, for example, is not able to slave its internal clock to the @clock or when it requires a specific clock to operate.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_structure_remove_field
function.description: Removes the field with the given name. If the field with the given name does not exist, the structure is unchanged.

parameter.name: fieldname
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the field to remove

function.name: gst_base_audio_sink_set_slave_method
function.description:
Controls how clock slaving will be performed in @sink.
Since: 0.10.16

function.name: gst_fft_s16_window
function.description: This calls the window function @window on the @timedata sample buffer.

function.name: gst_init
function.description:
Initializes the GStreamer library, setting up internal path lists, registering built-in elements, and loading standard plugins.
This function should be called before calling any other GLib functions. If this is not an option, your program must initialise the GLib thread system using g_thread_init() before any other GLib functions are called.
<note><para> This function will terminate your program if it was unable to initialize GStreamer for some reason. If you want your program to fall back, use gst_init_check() instead. </para></note>
WARNING: This function does not work in the same way as corresponding functions in other glib-style libraries, such as gtk_init(). In particular, unknown command line options cause this function to abort program execution.

function.name: gst_buffer_get_caps
function.description:
Gets the media type of the buffer. This can be NULL if there is no media type attached to this buffer.
Returns NULL if there were no caps on this buffer.
function.return: NULL if there were no caps on this buffer.

function.name: gst_missing_plugin_message_get_description
function.description: Returns: a newly-allocated description string, or NULL on error. Free
function.return: a newly-allocated description string, or NULL on error. Free string with g_free() when not needed any longer.

function.name: gst_rtsp_range_free
function.description: Free the memory alocated by @range.

function.name: gst_audio_filter_class_add_pad_templates
function.description:
Convenience function to add pad templates to this element class, with @allowed_caps as the caps that can be handled.
This function is usually used from within a GObject base_init function.
Since: 0.10.12

parameter.name: allowed_caps
parameter.parameter_description: what formats the filter can handle, as #GstCaps

function.name: gst_pad_add_buffer_probe_full
function.description:
Adds a probe that will be called for all buffers passing through a pad. See gst_pad_add_data_probe() for more information.
The @notify function is called when the probe is disconnected and usually used to free @data.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: pad to add the buffer probe handler to

parameter.name: handler
parameter.parameter_description: function to call when buffer are passed over pad

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: data to pass along with the handler

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: function to call when the probe is disconnected, or NULL

function.return:
The handler id
Since: 0.10.20

function.name: gst_bin_find_unlinked_pad
function.description: Recursively looks for elements with an unlinked pad of the given direction within the specified bin and returns an unlinked pad if one is found, or NULL otherwise. If a pad is found, the caller owns a reference to it and should use gst_object_unref() on the pad when it is not needed any longer.

parameter.name: bin
parameter.parameter_description: bin in which to look for elements with unlinked pads

parameter.name: direction
parameter.parameter_description: whether to look for an unlinked source or sink pad

function.return:
unlinked pad of the given direction, or NULL.
Since: 0.10.20

function.name: gst_tag_get_nick
function.description: Returns: the human-readable name of this tag
function.return: the human-readable name of this tag

function.description: Add a new SDES item for @ssrc to @packet.

parameter.name: ssrc
parameter.parameter_description: the SSRC of the new item to add

function.return: %TRUE if the item could be added, %FALSE if the maximum amount of items has been exceeded for the SDES packet or the MTU has been reached.

function.name: gst_clock_id_ref
function.description: Increase the refcount of given @id.
function.return:
The same #GstClockID with increased refcount.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_skip_to_byte
function.description: Skips until the next byte.

%TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_video_orientation_get_vcenter
function.description:
Get the vertical centering offset from the given object.

function.return: %TRUE in case the element supports centering

function.name: gst_bus_pop_filtered
function.description: Get a message matching @type from the bus. Will discard all messages on the bus that do not match @type and that have been posted before the first message that does match @type. If there is no message matching @type on the bus, all messages will be discarded.

parameter.name: types
parameter.parameter_description: message types to take into account

function.return:
The next #GstMessage matching @type that is on the bus, or NULL if the bus is empty or there is no message matching @type. The message is taken from the bus and needs to be unreffed with gst_message_unref() after usage.
MT safe.
Since: 0.10.15

function.name: gst_mixer_mute_toggled
function.description:
This function is called by the mixer implementation to produce a notification message on the bus indicating that the given track has changed mute state.
This function only works for GstElements that are implementing the GstMixer interface, and the element needs to have been provided a bus.

parameter.name: track
parameter.parameter_description: the GstMixerTrack that has change mute state.

parameter.name: mute
parameter.parameter_description: the new state of the mute flag on the track

function.name: gst_rtsp_watch_new
function.return:
a #GstRTSPWatch that can be used for asynchronous RTSP communication. Free with gst_rtsp_watch_unref () after usage.
Since: 0.10.23

function.name: gst_pad_set_fixatecaps_function

%TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

parameter.parameter_description: a #GstTagList to get the tag from

function.return: TRUE, if a value was copied, FALSE if the tag didn't exist in the given list.

function.name: gst_pad_get_query_types_default
function.description: Invoke the default dispatcher for the query types on the pad.
function.return: an zero-terminated array of #GstQueryType, or NULL if none of the internally-linked pads has a query types function.

function.name: gst_base_src_set_do_timestamp
function.description:
Configure @src to automatically timestamp outgoing buffers based on the current running_time of the pipeline. This property is mostly useful for live sources.
Since: 0.10.15

function.description: Set the reason string to @reason in @packet.
function.return: TRUE if the string could be set.

function.name: gst_structure_fixate_field_nearest_fraction
function.description: Fixates a #GstStructure by changing the given field to the nearest fraction to @target_numerator/@target_denominator that is a subset of the existing field.

parameter.name: target_numerator
parameter.parameter_description: The numerator of the target value of the fixation

parameter.name: target_denominator
parameter.parameter_description: The denominator of the target value of the fixation

function.return: TRUE if the structure could be fixated

function.name: gst_object_get_value_array
function.description:
Function to be able to get an array of values for one element properties
If the GstValueArray->values array is NULL, it will be created by the function. The type of the values in the array are the same as the property's type.
The g_object_* functions are just convenience functions for GObject

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that has controlled properties

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the time that should be processed

function.return: %TRUE if the given array(s) could be filled, %FALSE otherwise Since: 0.9

function.name: gst_pad_push_event
function.description:
Sends the event to the peer of the given pad. This function is mainly used by elements to send events to their peer elements.
This function takes owership of the provided event so you should gst_event_ref() it if you want to reuse the event after this call.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to push the event to.

parameter.name: event
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstEvent to send to the pad.

function.return:
TRUE if the event was handled.
MT safe.

function.description: Removes all buffers from @adapter.

parameter.name: root
parameter.parameter_description: The name of the root object to build

function.return: TRUE on success, FALSE otherwise

Extracts the buffering stats values from @query.

The new message.

The plugin with the given name or NULL if the plugin was not found. gst_object_unref() after usage.

%TRUE if the element requires a clock

The new latency message.

Get the horizontal centering offset from the given object.

the internal time of the clock. Or GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE when given invalid input.

function.description: Get the information of @media

The remaining number of bits of @reader instance.

function.name: gst_dp_validate_payload
function.description: Validates the given packet payload using the given packet header by checking the CRC checksum.

parameter.name: header_length
parameter.parameter_description: the length of the packet header

parameter.name: header
parameter.parameter_description: the byte array of the packet header

parameter.name: payload
parameter.parameter_description: the byte array of the packet payload

function.return: %TRUE if the CRC matches, or no CRC checksum is present.

function.name: gst_value_compare
function.description: Compares @value1 and @value2. If @value1 and @value2 cannot be compared, the function returns GST_VALUE_UNORDERED. Otherwise, if @value1 is greater than @value2, GST_VALUE_GREATER_THAN is returned. If @value1 is less than @value2, GST_VALUE_LESS_THAN is returned. If the values are equal, GST_VALUE_EQUAL is returned.
function.return: A #GstValueCompareType value

function.name: gst_video_orientation_get_hflip
function.description:
Get the horizontal flipping state (%TRUE for flipped) from the given object.
Since: 0.10.11
function.return: %TRUE in case the element supports flipping

function.name: gst_mini_object_replace
function.description: Modifies a pointer to point to a new mini-object. The modification is done atomically, and the reference counts are updated correctly. Either @newdata and the value pointed to by @olddata may be NULL.

parameter.name: olddata
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a pointer to a mini-object to be replaced

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_sdes_get_item_count
function.description: Get the number of items in the SDES packet @packet.
function.return: The number of items in @packet.

function.name: gst_trace_flush
gst_bus_set_sync_handler
function.description:
Sets the synchronous handler on the bus. The function will be called every time a new message is posted on the bus. Note that the function will be called in the same thread context as the posting object. This function is usually only called by the creator of the bus. Applications should handle messages asynchronously using the gst_bus watch and poll functions.
You cannot replace an existing sync_handler. You can pass NULL to this function, which will clear the existing handler.

parameter.name: bus
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstBus to install the handler on

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: User data that will be sent to the handler function.

function.name: gst_uri_protocol_is_supported
function.description: Checks if an element exists that supports the given URI protocol. Note that a positive return value does not imply that a subsequent call to gst_element_make_from_uri() is guaranteed to work.

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: Whether to check for a source or a sink

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.parameter_description: Protocol that should be checked for (e.g. "http" or "smb")

function.return:
TRUE
Since: 0.10.13

function.name: gst_formats_contains
function.description: See if the given format is inside the format array.
function.return: TRUE if the format is found inside the array

function.name: gst_pad_query_position
function.description: Queries a pad for the stream position.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to invoke the position query on.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to the #GstFormat asked for. On return contains the #GstFormat used.

parameter.name: cur
parameter.parameter_description: A location in which to store the current position, or NULL.

function.return: TRUE if the query could be performed.

function.name: gst_bus_add_watch_full
function.description:
Adds a bus watch to the default main context with the given @priority. This function is used to receive asynchronous messages in the main loop. There can only be a single bus watch per bus, you must remove it before you can set a new one.
When @func is called, the message belongs to the caller; if you want to keep a copy of it, call gst_message_ref() before leaving @func.
The watch can be removed using g_source_remove() or by returning FALSE from @func.

parameter.name: bus
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstBus to create the watch for.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: A function to call when a message is received.

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: the function to call when the source is removed.

function.return:
The event source id.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_provide_clock
function.description: Get the clock provided by the given element. <note>An element is only required to provide a clock in the PAUSED state. Some elements can provide a clock in other states.</note>
function.return:
the GstClock provided by the element or %NULL if no clock could be provided. Unref after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_plugin_get_source
function.description: get the source module the plugin belongs to.

parameter.name: plugin
parameter.parameter_description: plugin to get the source of

function.return: the source of the plugin

function.name: gst_net_time_packet_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GstNetTimePacket from a buffer received over the network. The caller is responsible for ensuring that @buffer is at least #GST_NET_TIME_PACKET_SIZE bytes long.
If @buffer is #NULL, the local and remote times will be set to #GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE.
MT safe. Caller owns return value (g_free to free).

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: a buffer from which to construct the packet, or NULL

function.return: The new #GstNetTimePacket.

function.name: gst_segment_set_last_stop
function.description:
Set the last observed stop position in the segment to @position.
This field should be set to allow seeking requests relative to the current playing position.

function.name: gst_pad_push
function.description:
Pushes a buffer to the peer of @pad.
This function will call an installed pad block before triggering any installed pad probes.
If the caps on @buffer are different from the currently configured caps on @pad, this function will call any installed setcaps function on @pad (see gst_pad_set_setcaps_function()). In case of failure to renegotiate the new format, this function returns #GST_FLOW_NOT_NEGOTIATED.
The function proceeds calling gst_pad_chain() on the peer pad and returns the value from that function. If @pad has no peer, #GST_FLOW_NOT_LINKED will be returned.
In all cases, success or failure, the caller loses its reference to @buffer after calling this function.

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstBuffer to push returns GST_FLOW_ERROR if not.

function.return:
a #GstFlowReturn from the peer pad.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_event_has_name
function.description: Checks if @event has the given @name. This function is usually used to check the name of a custom event.
function.return:
%TRUE if @name matches the name of the event structure.
Since: 0.10.20

function.name: gst_data_queue_is_empty
function.description: Queries if there are any items in the @queue. MT safe.
function.return: #TRUE if @queue is empty.

function.name: gst_caps_subtract
function.description: Subtracts the @subtrahend from the @minuend. <note>This function does not work reliably if optional properties for caps are included on one caps and omitted on the other.</note>
function.return: the resulting caps

function.name: gst_bus_async_signal_func
function.description: A helper #GstBusFunc that can be used to convert all asynchronous messages into signals.
function.return: TRUE

function.name: gst_pad_is_linked
function.description: Checks if a @pad is linked to another pad or not.
function.return:
TRUE if the pad is linked, FALSE otherwise.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_tuner_norm_changed
function.description: Called by elements implementing the #GstTuner interface when the current norm changes. Fires the #GstTuner::norm-changed signal.

function.name: gst_fft_s32_free
function.description: This frees the memory allocated for @self.

function.name: gst_structure_has_name
function.description: Checks if the structure has the given name
function.return: TRUE if @name matches the name of the structure.

function.name: GstColorBalanceChannel
function.description: Fired when the value of the indicated channel has changed.

function.name: GstBin
function.description:
Will be emitted when the bin needs to perform latency calculations. This signal is only emited for toplevel bins or when async-handling is enabled.
Only one signal handler is invoked. If no signals are connected, the default handler is invoked, which will query and distribute the lowest possible latency to all sinks.
Connect to this signal if the default latency calculations are not sufficient, like when you need different latencies for different sinks in the same pipeline.
Since: 0.10.22

function.name: gst_message_parse_clock_lost
function.description:
Extracts the lost clock from the GstMessage. The clock object returned remains valid until the message is freed.
MT safe.

parameter.name: clock
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to hold the lost clock

function.name: gst_xml_write
function.description: Converts the given element into an XML presentation.
function.return: a pointer to an XML document

function.name: gst_element_provides_clock
function.description: Query if the element provides a clock. A #GstClock provided by an element can be used as the global #GstClock for the pipeline. An element that can provide a clock is only required to do so in the PAUSED state, this means when it is fully negotiated and has allocated the resources to operate the clock.
function.return:
%TRUE if the element provides a clock
MT safe.

function.name: gst_plugin_load
function.return: A reference to a loaded plugin, or NULL on error.

function.name: gst_value_get_date
function.description: Gets the contents of @value.
function.return: the contents of @value

function.name: gst_poll_restart
function.description:
Restart any gst_poll_wait() that is in progress. This function is typically used after adding or removing descriptors to @set.
If @set is not controllable, then this call will have no effect.
Since: 0.10.18

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_steal_body
function.description: Take the body of @msg and store it in @data and @size. After this method, the body and size of @msg will be set to #NULL and 0 respectively.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.

function.name: gst_ghost_pad_set_target
function.description: Set the new target of the ghostpad @gpad. Any existing target is unlinked and links to the new target are established. if @newtarget is NULL the target will be cleared.
function.return: TRUE if the new target could be set. This function can return FALSE when the internal pads could not be linked.

function.name: gst_index_get_assoc_entry
function.description: Finds the given format/value in the index

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: the id of the index writer

function.return: the entry associated with the value or NULL if the value was not found.

function.name: gst_object_replace
function.description:
Unrefs the #GstObject pointed to by @oldobj, refs @newobj and puts @newobj in *@oldobj. Be carefull when calling this function, it does not take any locks. You might want to lock the object owning @oldobj pointer before calling this function.
Make sure not to LOCK @oldobj because it might be unreffed which could cause a deadlock when it is disposed.

function.name: gst_clock_set_calibration
function.description:
Adjusts the rate and time of @clock. A rate of 1/1 is the normal speed of the clock. Values bigger than 1/1 make the clock go faster.
@internal and @external are calibration parameters that arrange that gst_clock_get_time() should have been @external at internal time @internal. This internal time should not be in the future; that is, it should be less than the value of gst_clock_get_internal_time() when this function is called.
Subsequent calls to gst_clock_get_time() will return clock times computed as follows:
<programlisting> time = (internal_time - internal) * rate_num / rate_denom + external </programlisting>
This formula is implemented in gst_clock_adjust_unlocked(). Of course, it tries to do the integer arithmetic as precisely as possible.
Note that gst_clock_get_time() always returns increasing values so when you move the clock backwards, gst_clock_get_time() will report the previous value until the clock catches up.
MT safe.

parameter.name: rate_num
parameter.parameter_description: the numerator of the rate of the clock relative to its internal time

parameter.name: rate_denom
parameter.parameter_description: the denominator of the rate of the clock

function.name: gst_element_set_state
function.description:
Sets the state of the element. This function will try to set the requested state by going through all the intermediary states and calling the class's state change function for each.
This function can return #GST_STATE_CHANGE_ASYNC, in which case the element will perform the remainder of the state change asynchronously in another thread. An application can use gst_element_get_state() to wait for the completion of the state change or it can wait for a state change message on the bus.
function.return:
Result of the state change using #GstStateChangeReturn.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_tag_exists
function.description: Checks if the given type is already registered.
function.return: TRUE if the type is already registered

function.name: gst_tag_register
function.description:
Registers a new tag type for the use with GStreamer's type system. If a type with that name is already registered, that one is used. The old registration may have used a different type however. So don't rely on your supplied values.
Important: if you do not supply a merge function the implication will be that there can only be one single value for this tag in a tag list and any additional values will silenty be discarded when being added (unless #GST_TAG_MERGE_REPLACE, #GST_TAG_MERGE_REPLACE_ALL, or #GST_TAG_MERGE_PREPEND is used as merge mode, in which case the new value will replace the old one in the list).
The merge function will be called from gst_tag_list_copy_value() when it is required that one or more values for a tag be condensed into one single value. This may happen from gst_tag_list_get_string(), gst_tag_list_get_int(), gst_tag_list_get_double() etc. What will happen exactly in that case depends on how the tag was registered and if a merge function was supplied and if so which one.
Two default merge functions are provided: gst_tag_merge_use_first() and gst_tag_merge_strings_with_commas().

parameter.name: flag
parameter.parameter_description: a flag describing the type of tag info

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: the type this data is in

parameter.name: blurb
parameter.parameter_description: a human-readable description about this tag

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: function for merging multiple values of this tag, or NULL

function.name: gst_message_new_element
function.description: Create a new element-specific message. This is meant as a generic way of allowing one-way communication from an element to an application, for example "the firewire cable was unplugged". The format of the message should be documented in the element's documentation. The structure field can be NULL.

parameter.name: structure
parameter.parameter_description: The structure for the message. The message will take ownership of the structure.

function.return:
The new element message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_segment_set_seek
function.description:
Update the segment structure with the field values of a seek event (see gst_event_new_seek()).
After calling this method, the segment field last_stop and time will contain the requested new position in the segment. The new requested position in the segment depends on @rate and @start_type and @stop_type.
For positive @rate, the new position in the segment is the new @segment start field when it was updated with a @start_type different from #GST_SEEK_TYPE_NONE. If no update was performed on @segment start position (#GST_SEEK_TYPE_NONE), @start is ignored and @segment last_stop is unmodified.
For negative @rate, the new position in the segment is the new @segment stop field when it was updated with a @stop_type different from #GST_SEEK_TYPE_NONE. If no stop was previously configured in the segment, the duration of the segment will be used to update the stop position. If no update was performed on @segment stop position (#GST_SEEK_TYPE_NONE), @stop is ignored and @segment last_stop is unmodified.
The applied rate of the segment will be set to 1.0 by default. If the caller can apply a rate change, it should update @segment rate and applied_rate after calling this function.
@update will be set to TRUE if a seek should be performed to the segment last_stop field. This field can be FALSE if, for example, only the @rate has been changed but not the playback position.

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: the seek flags for the segment

parameter.name: update
parameter.parameter_description: boolean holding whether last_stop was updated.

function.name: gst_filter_run
function.description:
Iterates over the elements in @list, calling @func with the list item data for each item. If @func returns TRUE, @data is prepended to the list of results returned. If @first is true, the search is halted after the first result is found.
Since gst_filter_run() knows nothing about the type of @data, no reference will be taken (if @data refers to an object) and no copy of @data wil be made in any other way when prepending @data to the list of results.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: the function to execute for each item

parameter.name: first

function.name: gst_value_can_union
function.description: Determines if @value1 and @value2 can be non-trivially unioned. Any two values can be trivially unioned by adding both of them to a GstValueList. However, certain types have the possibility to be unioned in a simpler way. For example, an integer range and an integer can be unioned if the integer is a subset of the integer range. If there is the possibility that two values can be unioned, this function returns TRUE.
function.return: TRUE if there is a function allowing the two values to be unioned.

function.name: gst_base_src_set_live
function.description:
If the element listens to a live source, @live should be set to %TRUE.
A live source will not produce data in the PAUSED state and will therefore not be able to participate in the PREROLL phase of a pipeline. To signal this fact to the application and the pipeline, the state change return value of the live source will be GST_STATE_CHANGE_NO_PREROLL.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_get_uint64_be
function.description: Read an unsigned 64 bit big endian integer into @val and update the current position.

function.return:
%TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.
Since: 0.10.22

function.name: gst_object_get_value_arrays
function.description:
Function to be able to get an array of values for one or more given element properties.
If the GstValueArray->values array in list nodes is NULL, it will be created by the function. The type of the values in the array are the same as the property's type.
The g_object_* functions are just convenience functions for GObject

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that has controlled properties

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the time that should be processed

parameter.name: value_arrays
parameter.parameter_description: list to return the control-values in

function.return: %TRUE if the given array(s) could be filled, %FALSE otherwise Since: 0.9

function.name: gst_structure_n_fields
function.description: Get the number of fields in the structure.
function.return: the number of fields in the structure

function.name: gst_base_audio_sink_create_ringbuffer
function.description: Create and return the #GstRingBuffer for @sink. This function will call the ::create_ringbuffer vmethod and will set @sink as the parent of the returned buffer (see gst_object_set_parent()).
function.return: The new ringbuffer of @sink.

function.name: gst_caps_is_equal
function.description:
Checks if the given caps represent the same set of caps. <note>This function does not work reliably if optional properties for caps are included on one caps and omitted on the other.</note>
This function deals correctly with passing NULL for any of the caps.
function.return: TRUE if both caps are equal.

function.name: gst_bus_enable_sync_message_emission
function.description:
Instructs GStreamer to emit the "sync-message" signal after running the bus's sync handler. This function is here so that code can ensure that they can synchronously receive messages without having to affect what the bin's sync handler is.
This function may be called multiple times. To clean up, the caller is responsible for calling gst_bus_disable_sync_message_emission() as many times as this function is called.
While this function looks similar to gst_bus_add_signal_watch(), it is not exactly the same -- this function enables <emphasis>synchronous</emphasis> emission of signals when messages arrive; gst_bus_add_signal_watch() adds an idle callback to pop messages off the bus <emphasis>asynchronously</emphasis>. The sync-message signal comes from the thread of whatever object posted the message; the "message" signal is marshalled to the main thread via the main loop.
MT safe.

parameter.name: bus
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstBus on which you want to receive the "sync-message" signal

function.name: gst_sdp_media_formats_len
function.description: Get the number of formats in @media.
function.return: the number of formats in @media.

function.name: gst_structure_get_boolean
function.description: Sets the boolean pointed to by @value corresponding to the value of the given field. Caller is responsible for making sure the field exists and has the correct type.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a #gboolean to set

function.return: TRUE if the value could be set correctly. If there was no field with @fieldname or the existing field did not contain a boolean, this function returns FALSE.

function.name: gst_value_get_int_range_min
function.description: Gets the minimum of the range specified by @value.
function.return: the minimum of the range

function.name: gst_byte_reader_get_int32_le
function.description: Read a signed 32 bit little endian integer into @val and update the current position.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #gint32 to store the result

function.return:
%TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.
Since: 0.10.22

function.name: gst_audio_check_channel_positions
function.description:
This functions checks if the given channel positions are valid. Channel positions are valid if: <itemizedlist> <listitem><para>No channel positions appears twice or all positions are %GST_AUDIO_CHANNEL_POSITION_NONE. </para></listitem> <listitem><para>Either all or none of the channel positions are %GST_AUDIO_CHANNEL_POSITION_NONE. </para></listitem> <listitem><para>%GST_AUDIO_CHANNEL_POSITION_FRONT_MONO and %GST_AUDIO_CHANNEL_POSITION_LEFT or %GST_AUDIO_CHANNEL_POSITION_FRONT_RIGHT don't appear together in the given positions. </para></listitem> </itemizedlist>
Since: 0.10.20
function.return: %TRUE if the given channel positions are valid and %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_rtsp_range_parse
function.description: Parse @rangestr to a #GstRTSPTimeRange.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK on success.

function.name: gst_bin_recalculate_latency
function.description:
Query @bin for the current latency using and reconfigures this latency to all the elements with a LATENCY event.
This method is typically called on the pipeline when a #GST_MESSAGE_LATENCY is posted on the bus.
This function simply emits the 'do-latency' signal so any custom latency calculations will be performed.
function.return:
%TRUE if the latency could be queried and reconfigured.
Since: 0.10.22.

function.name: gst_pipeline_set_auto_flush_bus
function.description:
Usually, when a pipeline goes from READY to NULL state, it automatically flushes all pending messages on the bus, which is done for refcounting purposes, to break circular references.
This means that applications that update state using (async) bus messages (e.g. do certain things when a pipeline goes from PAUSED to READY) might not get to see messages when the pipeline is shut down, because they might be flushed before they can be dispatched in the main thread. This behaviour can be disabled using this function.
It is important that all messages on the bus are handled when the automatic flushing is disabled else memory leaks will be introduced.
MT safe.
Since: 0.10.4

parameter.name: auto_flush
parameter.parameter_description: whether or not to automatically flush the bus when the pipeline goes from READY to NULL state

function.name: gst_rtsp_connection_free
function.description: Close and free @conn.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK on success.

When this function is invoked on newly allocated data (with malloc or on the stack), its contents should be set to 0 before calling this function.
function.return: a #GstSDPResult.

@len must be even and to get the best performance a product of 2, 3 and 5. To get the next number with this characteristics use gst_fft_next_fast_length().

function.name: gst_pad_event_default
function.description: Invokes the default event handler for the given pad. End-of-stream and discontinuity events are handled specially, and then the event is sent to all pads internally linked to @pad. Note that if there are many possible sink pads that are internally linked to @pad, only one will be sent an event. Multi-sinkpad elements should implement custom event handlers.

The return value #GST_PAD_LINK_OK should be used when the connection can be made.
The return value #GST_PAD_LINK_REFUSED should be used when the connection cannot be made for some reason.
If @link is installed on a source pad, it should call the #GstPadLinkFunction of the peer sink pad, if present.

Sets the queue to flushing state if @flushing is #TRUE. If set to flushing state, any incoming data on the @queue will be discarded. Any call currently blocking on #gst_data_queue_push or #gst_data_queue_pop will return straight away with a return value of #FALSE. function.name: gst_mixer_record_toggled
function.description:
This function is called by the mixer implementation to produce a notification message on the bus indicating that the given track has changed recording state.
This function only works for GstElements that are implementing the GstMixer interface, and the element needs to have been provided a bus.

parameter.name: track
parameter.parameter_description: the GstMixerTrack that has changed recording state.

parameter.name: record
parameter.parameter_description: the new state of the record flag on the track

function.name: gst_element_seek
function.description: Sends a seek event to an element. See gst_event_new_seek() for the details of the parameters. The seek event is sent to the element using gst_element_send_event().

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to send the event to.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: The format of the seek values

parameter.name: cur_type
parameter.parameter_description: The type and flags for the new current position

parameter.name: cur
parameter.parameter_description: The value of the new current position

parameter.name: stop_type
parameter.parameter_description: The type and flags for the new stop position

parameter.name: stop
parameter.parameter_description: The value of the new stop position

function.return:
%TRUE if the event was handled.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_fft_f32_new
function.description:
This returns a new #GstFFTF32 instance with the given parameters. It makes sense to keep one instance for several calls for speed reasons.
@len must be even and to get the best performance a product of 2, 3 and 5. To get the next number with this characteristics use gst_fft_next_fast_length().

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: Length of the FFT in the time domain

parameter.name: inverse
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the #GstFFTF32 instance should be used for the inverse FFT

function.return: a new #GstFFTF32 instance.

function.name: gst_alloc_trace_live_all
function.description: Get the total number of live registered alloc trace objects.
function.return: the total number of live registered alloc trace objects.

function.name: gst_pad_chain
function.description:
Chain a buffer to @pad.
The function returns #GST_FLOW_WRONG_STATE if the pad was flushing.
If the caps on @buffer are different from the current caps on @pad, this function will call any setcaps function (see gst_pad_set_setcaps_function()) installed on @pad. If the new caps are not acceptable for @pad, this function returns #GST_FLOW_NOT_NEGOTIATED.
The function proceeds calling the chain function installed on @pad (see gst_pad_set_chain_function()) and the return value of that function is returned to the caller. #GST_FLOW_NOT_SUPPORTED is returned if @pad has no chain function.
In all cases, success or failure, the caller loses its reference to @buffer after calling this function.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a sink #GstPad, returns GST_FLOW_ERROR if not.

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstBuffer to send, return GST_FLOW_ERROR if not.

function.return:
a #GstFlowReturn from the pad.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_peek_int32_be
function.description: Read a signed 32 bit big endian integer into @val but keep the current position.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #gint32 to store the result

function.return:
%TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.
Since: 0.10.22

function.name: gst_element_get_pad_from_template
function.description: Gets a pad from @element described by @templ. If the presence of @templ is #GST_PAD_REQUEST, requests a new pad. Can return %NULL for #GST_PAD_SOMETIMES templates.
function.return: the #GstPad, or NULL if one could not be found or created.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_validate
function.description: Check if the data pointed to by @buffer is a valid RTP packet using gst_rtp_buffer_validate_data(). Use this function to validate a packet before using the other functions in this module.
function.return: TRUE if @buffer is a valid RTP packet.

function.name: gst_element_factory_get_klass
function.description: Gets the class for this factory.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_free

function.name: gst_base_sink_set_max_lateness
function.description:
Sets the new max lateness value to @max_lateness. This value is used to decide if a buffer should be dropped or not based on the buffer timestamp and the current clock time. A value of -1 means an unlimited time.
Since: 0.10.4

function.return: TRUE if @caps is fixed

function.name: gst_dp_caps_from_packet
function.description:
Creates a newly allocated #GstCaps from the given packet.
This function does not check the arguments passed to it, use gst_dp_validate_packet() first if the header and payload data are unchecked.

parameter.name: header_length
parameter.parameter_description: the length of the packet header

parameter.name: header
parameter.parameter_description: the byte array of the packet header

parameter.name: payload
parameter.parameter_description: the byte array of the packet payload

function.return: A #GstCaps containing the caps represented in the packet, or NULL if the packet could not be converted.

function.name: gst_base_src_get_blocksize
function.description: Get the number of bytes that @src will push out with each buffer.
function.return:
the number of bytes pushed with each buffer.
Since: 0.10.22

function.name: gst_type_find_helper_for_buffer
function.description:
Tries to find what type of data is contained in the given #GstBuffer, the assumption being that the buffer represents the beginning of the stream or file.
All available typefinders will be called on the data in order of rank. If a typefinding function returns a probability of #GST_TYPE_FIND_MAXIMUM, typefinding is stopped immediately and the found caps will be returned right away. Otherwise, all available typefind functions will the tried, and the caps with the highest probability will be returned, or #NULL if the content of the buffer could not be identified.

parameter.name: obj
parameter.parameter_description: object doing the typefinding, or NULL (used for logging)

parameter.name: prob
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the probability of the found caps, or #NULL

function.return: The #GstCaps corresponding to the data, or #NULL if no type could be found. The caller should free the caps returned with gst_caps_unref().

function.name: gst_element_remove_pad
function.description:
Removes @pad from @element. @pad will be destroyed if it has not been referenced elsewhere using gst_object_unparent().
This function is used by plugin developers and should not be used by applications. Pads that were dynamically requested from elements with gst_element_get_request_pad() should be released with the gst_element_release_request_pad() function instead.
Pads are not automatically deactivated so elements should perform the needed steps to deactivate the pad in case this pad is removed in the PAUSED or PLAYING state. See gst_pad_set_active() for more information about deactivating pads.
The pad and the element should be unlocked when calling this function.
This function will emit the #GstElement::pad-removed signal on the element.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to remove from the element.

function.return:
%TRUE if the pad could be removed. Can return %FALSE if the pad does not belong to the provided element.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_get_uint64_le
function.description: Read an unsigned 64 bit little endian integer into @val and update the current position.

function.return:
%TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.
Since: 0.10.22

The list must not be modified by the calling code. <note>If you use this function in the #GInstanceInitFunc of an object class that has subclasses, make sure to pass the g_class parameter of the #GInstanceInitFunc here.</note>

parameter.name: element_class
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElementClass to get pad templates of.

function.return: the #GList of padtemplates.

Extracts the duration and format from the duration message. The duration might be GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE, which indicates that the duration has changed. Applications should always use a query to retrieve the duration of a pipeline.
MT safe.

parameter.name: duration
parameter.parameter_description: Result location for the duration, or NULL

function.name: gst_pad_template_new
function.description: Creates a new pad template with a name according to the given template and with the given arguments. This functions takes ownership of the provided caps, so be sure to not use them afterwards.

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstCaps set for the template. The caps are taken ownership of.

function.return: a new #GstPadTemplate.

function.name: gst_data_queue_push
function.description:
Pushes a #GstDataQueueItem (or a structure that begins with the same fields) on the @queue. If the @queue is full, the call will block until space is available, OR the @queue is set to flushing state. MT safe.
Note that this function has slightly different semantics than gst_pad_push() and gst_pad_push_event(): this function only takes ownership of @item and the #GstMiniObject contained in @item if the push was successful. If FALSE is returned, the caller is responsible for freeing @item and its contents.
function.return: #TRUE if the @item was successfully pushed on the @queue.

function.name: gst_pad_query_peer_convert
function.description: Queries the peer pad of a given sink pad to convert @src_val in @src_format to @dest_format.

parameter.name: pad

parameter.name: dest_format
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to the #GstFormat to convert to.

function.return: TRUE if the query could be performed.

function.name: gst_clock_id_wait_async
function.description:
Register a callback on the given #GstClockID @id with the given function and user_data. When passing a #GstClockID with an invalid time to this function, the callback will be called immediately with a time set to GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE. The callback will be called when the time of @id has been reached.
The callback @func can be invoked from any thread, either provided by the core or from a streaming thread. The application should be prepared for this.

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: User data passed in the callback

function.return:
the result of the non blocking wait.
MT safe.

function.description: Tunes the object to the given channel.

function.name: gst_caps_ref
function.description:
Add a reference to a #GstCaps object.
From this point on, until the caller calls gst_caps_unref() or gst_caps_make_writable(), it is guaranteed that the caps object will not change. This means its structures won't change, etc. To use a #GstCaps object, you must always have a refcount on it -- either the one made implicitly by gst_caps_new(), or via taking one explicitly with this function.
function.return: the same #GstCaps object.

function.name: gst_buffer_is_span_fast

Creates a new #GstCaps as a copy of the old @caps. The new caps will have a refcount of 1, owned by the caller. The structures are copied as well.
Note that this function is the semantic equivalent of a gst_caps_ref() followed by a gst_caps_make_writable(). If you only want to hold on to a reference to the data, you should use gst_caps_ref().
When you are finished with the caps, call gst_caps_unref() on it.
function.return: the new #GstCaps

Set the percentage of buffered data. This is a value between 0 and 100. The @busy indicator is %TRUE when the buffering is in progress.
Since: 0.10.20

function.name: gst_tag_image_data_to_image_buffer
function.description:
Helper function for tag-reading plugins to create a #GstBuffer suitable to add to a #GstTagList as an image tag (such as #GST_TAG_IMAGE or #GST_TAG_PREVIEW_IMAGE) from the encoded image data and an (optional) image type.
Background: cover art and other images in tags are usually stored as a blob of binary image data, often accompanied by a MIME type or some other content type string (e.g. 'png', 'jpeg', 'jpg'). Sometimes there is also an 'image type' to indicate what kind of image this is (e.g. front cover, back cover, artist, etc.). The image data may also be an URI to the image rather than the image itself.
In GStreamer, image tags are #GstBuffer<!-- -->s containing the raw image data, with the buffer caps describing the content type of the image (e.g. image/jpeg, image/png, text/uri-list). The buffer caps may contain an additional 'image-type' field of #GST_TYPE_TAG_IMAGE_TYPE to describe the type of image (front cover, back cover etc.). #GST_TAG_PREVIEW_IMAGE tags should not carry an image type, their type is already indicated via the special tag name.
This function will do various checks and typefind the encoded image data (we can't trust the declared mime type).

parameter.name: image_data_len
parameter.parameter_description: the length of the encoded image data at @image_data

parameter.name: image_type

function.return:
a newly-allocated image buffer for use in tag lists, or NULL
Since: 0.10.20

function.name: gst_value_list_get_value
function.description: Gets the value that is a member of the list contained in @value and has the index @index.

Looks up a child element by the given name.

the child object or %NULL if not found. Unref after usage.
