function.name: gst_bin_iterate_sinks
function.description:
Gets an iterator for all elements in the bin that have the #GST_ELEMENT_IS_SINK flag set.
Each element yielded by the iterator will have its refcount increased, so unref after use.
MT safe. Caller owns returned value.
function.return: a #GstIterator of #GstElement, or NULL

function.name: gst_bus_poll
function.description:
Poll the bus for messages. Will block while waiting for messages to come. You can specify a maximum time to poll with the @timeout parameter. If @timeout is negative, this function will block indefinitely.
All messages not in @events will be popped off the bus and will be ignored.
Because poll is implemented using the "message" signal enabled by gst_bus_add_signal_watch(), calling gst_bus_poll() will cause the "message" signal to be emitted for every message that poll sees. Thus a "message" signal handler will see the same messages that this function sees -- neither will steal messages from the other.
This function will run a main loop from the default main context when polling.
You should never use this function, since it is pure evil. This is especially true for GUI applications based on Gtk+ or Qt, but also for any other non-trivial application that uses the GLib main loop. As this function runs a GLib main loop, any callback attached to the default GLib main context may be invoked. This could be timeouts, GUI events, I/O events etc.; even if gst_bus_poll() is called with a 0 timeout. Any of these callbacks may do things you do not expect, e.g. destroy the main application window or some other resource; change other application state; display a dialog and run another main loop until the user clicks it away. In short, using this function may add a lot of complexity to your code through unexpected re-entrancy and unexpected changes to your application's state.
For 0 timeouts use gst_bus_pop_filtered() instead of this function; for other short timeouts use gst_bus_timed_pop_filtered(); everything else is better handled by setting up an asynchronous bus watch and doing things from there.

parameter.name: events
parameter.parameter_description: a mask of #GstMessageType, representing the set of message types to poll for.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.parameter_description: the poll timeout, as a #GstClockTimeDiff, or -1 to poll indefinitely.

function.return: The message that was received, or NULL if the poll timed out. The message is taken from the bus and needs to be unreffed with gst_message_unref() after usage.

function.name: gst_clock_set_resolution
function.description: Set the accuracy of the clock. Some clocks have the possibility to operate with different accuracy at the expense of more resource usage. There is normally no need to change the default resolution of a clock. The resolution of a clock can only be changed if the clock has the #GST_CLOCK_FLAG_CAN_SET_RESOLUTION flag set.
function.return: the new resolution of the clock.

function.name: gst_child_proxy_set
function.description: Sets properties of the parent object and its children.

parameter.name: first_property_name
parameter.parameter_description: name of the first property to set

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: value for the first property, followed optionally by more name/value pairs, followed by NULL

function.name: gst_element_factory_get_description
function.description: Gets the description for this factory.
function.return: the description

function.name: gst_object_get_name_prefix
function.description: Returns: the name prefix of @object. g_free() after usage.
function.return:
the name prefix of @object. g_free() after usage.
MT safe. This function grabs and releases @object's LOCK.

function.name: gst_debug_set_colored
function.description: Sets or unsets the use of coloured debugging output.

parameter.parameter_description: Whether to use colored output or not

function.name: gst_object_set_controller
function.description: Sets the controller on the given GObject

parameter.name: format

function.name: gst_event_new_new_segment
function.description:
Allocate a new newsegment event with the given format/values tripplets
This method calls gst_event_new_new_segment_full() passing a default value of 1.0 for applied_rate

parameter.name: update
parameter.parameter_description: is this segment an update to a previous one

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: The format of the segment values

parameter.name: start
parameter.parameter_description: the start value of the segment

parameter.name: stop
parameter.parameter_description: the stop value of the segment

function.return: A new newsegment event.

function.name: gst_mixer_option_changed
function.description:
This function is called by the mixer implementation to produce a notification message on the bus indicating that the given options object has changed state.
This function only works for GstElements that are implementing the GstMixer interface, and the element needs to have been provided a bus.

parameter.name: opts
parameter.parameter_description: the GstMixerOptions that has changed value.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: the new value of the GstMixerOptions.

function.name: gst_format_iterate_definitions
function.description: Iterate all the registered formats. The format definition is read only.
function.return: A GstIterator of #GstFormatDefinition.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_new_allocate_len

parameter.name: packet_len
parameter.parameter_description: the total length of the packet

function.return: A newly allocated buffer that can hold an RTP packet of @packet_len.

function.name: gst_structure_id_empty_new
function.description: Creates a new, empty #GstStructure with the given name as a GQuark.
function.return: a new, empty #GstStructure

function.name: gst_segment_set_duration
function.description:
Set the duration of the segment to @duration. This function is mainly used by elements that perform seeking and know the total duration of the segment.
This field should be set to allow seeking requests relative to the duration.

parameter.name: duration
parameter.parameter_description: the duration of the segment info or -1 if unknown.

function.name: gst_sdp_media_init
function.description:
Initialize @media so that its contents are as if it was freshly allocated with gst_sdp_media_new(). This function is mostly used to initialize a media allocated on the stack. gst_sdp_media_uninit() undoes this operation.
When this function is invoked on newly allocated data (with malloc or on the stack), its contents should be set to 0 before calling this function.
function.return: a #GstSDPResult.

function.name: gst_ring_buffer_debug_spec_buff
function.description: Print debug info about the buffer sized in @spec to the debug log.

parameter.name: registry
parameter.parameter_description: the registry to add the plugin to

function.return:
TRUE on success.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_netaddress_get_net_type
function.description: Get the type of address stored in @naddr.
function.return: the network type stored in @naddr.

function.description: Retrieves an iterator of @element's source pads.

the #GstIterator of #GstPad. Unref each pad after use.

a new #GstPad, or NULL in case of an error.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object this message relates to or NULL if none

function.name: gst_message_parse_new_clock
function.description:
Extracts the new clock from the GstMessage. The clock object returned remains valid until the message is freed.
MT safe.

parameter.name: clock
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to hold the selected new clock

function.name: gst_bus_peek
function.description: Peek the message on the top of the bus' queue. The message will remain on the bus' message queue. A reference is returned, and needs to be unreffed by the caller.
function.return:
The #GstMessage that is on the bus, or NULL if the bus is empty.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_collect_pads_read
function.description:
Get a pointer in @bytes where @size bytes can be read from the given pad @data.
This function should be called with @pads LOCK held, such as in the callback.

parameter.name: bytes
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a byte array

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to read

function.return:
The number of bytes available for consumption in the memory pointed to by @bytes. This can be less than @size and is 0 if the pad is end-of-stream.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_tuner_get_channel
function.description: Retrieve the current channel from the tuner.

parameter.name: tuner
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstTuner (a #GstElement) to get the current channel from.

function.return: the current channel of the tuner object.

function.name: gst_clock_id_wait
function.description:
Perform a blocking wait on @id. @id should have been created with gst_clock_new_single_shot_id() or gst_clock_new_periodic_id() and should not have been unscheduled with a call to gst_clock_id_unschedule().
If the @jitter argument is not %NULL and this function returns #GST_CLOCK_OK or #GST_CLOCK_EARLY, it will contain the difference against the clock and the time of @id when this method was called. Positive values indicate how late @id was relative to the clock (in which case this function will return #GST_CLOCK_EARLY). Negative values indicate how much time was spent waiting on the clock before this function returned.

parameter.name: jitter
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer that will contain the jitter, can be %NULL.

function.return:
the result of the blocking wait. #GST_CLOCK_EARLY will be returned if the current clock time is past the time of @id, #GST_CLOCK_OK if @id was scheduled in time. #GST_CLOCK_UNSCHEDULED if @id was unscheduled with gst_clock_id_unschedule().
MT safe.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_take_header
function.description: Add a header with key @field and @value to @msg. This function takes ownership of @value.
function.return:
a #GstRTSPResult.
Since: 0.10.23

function.name: gst_element_link_many
function.description: Chain together a series of elements. Uses gst_element_link(). Make sure you have added your elements to a bin or pipeline with gst_bin_add() before trying to link them.

parameter.name: element_1
parameter.parameter_description: the first #GstElement in the link chain.

parameter.name: element_2
parameter.parameter_description: the second #GstElement in the link chain.

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: the NULL-terminated list of elements to link in order.

function.return: TRUE on success, FALSE otherwise.

function.return: TRUE, if a value was copied, FALSE if the tag didn't exist in the given list.

function.return:
TRUE if the device could be acquired, FALSE on error.
MT safe.

a new #GstIterator of #GstPad or %NULL when the pad does not have an iterator function configured. Use gst_iterator_free() after usage.

function.return:
%TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.description: Gets the current clock used by @pipeline.

Initializes a #GstByteReader instance to read from @data. This function can be called on already initialized instances.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: Data from which the #GstByteReader should read

function.name: gst_property_probe_needs_probe
function.description: Checks whether a property needs a probe. This might be because the property wasn't initialized before, or because host setup changed. This might be, for example, because a new device was added, and thus device probing needs to be refreshed to display the new device.

parameter.name: probe
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPropertyProbe object to which the given property belongs.

parameter.name: pspec
parameter.parameter_description: a #GParamSpec that identifies the property to check.

function.return: TRUE if the property needs a new probe, FALSE if not.

function.name: gst_rtcp_buffer_new_take_data
function.description: Create a new buffer and set the data and size of the buffer to @data and @len respectively. @data will be freed when the buffer is unreffed, so this function transfers ownership of @data to the new buffer.
function.return: A newly allocated buffer with @data and of size @len.

function.name: gst_buffer_copy_metadata
function.description:
Copies the metadata from @src into @dest. The data, size and mallocdata fields are not copied.
@flags indicate which fields will be copied. Use #GST_BUFFER_COPY_ALL to copy all the metadata fields.
This function is typically called from a custom buffer copy function after creating @dest and setting the data, size, mallocdata.
Since: 0.10.13

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: flags indicating what metadata fields should be copied.

function.name: gst_trace_new
function.description: Create a ringbuffer of @size in the file with @filename to store trace results in.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the max size of the file

function.return: a new #GstTrace.

function.name: gst_rtcp_buffer_validate_data
function.description: Check if the @data and @size point to the data of a valid RTCP (compound) packet. Use this function to validate a packet before using the other functions in this module.
function.return: TRUE if the data points to a valid RTCP packet.

function.name: gst_object_check_uniqueness
function.description: Checks to see if there is any object named @name in @list. This function does not do any locking of any kind. You might want to protect the provided list with the lock of the owner of the list. This function will lock each #GstObject in the list to compare the name, so be carefull when passing a list with a locked object.

parameter.name: list
parameter.parameter_description: a list of #GstObject to check through

function.return:
TRUE if a #GstObject named @name does not appear in @list, FALSE if it does.
MT safe. Grabs and releases the LOCK of each object in the list.

function.name: gst_mixer_options_list_changed
function.description:
This function is called by the mixer implementation to produce a notification message on the bus indicating that the list of possible options of a given options object has changed.
The new options are not contained in the message on purpose. Applications should call gst_mixer_option_get_values() on @opts to make @opts update its internal state and obtain the new list of values.
This function only works for GstElements that are implementing the GstMixer interface, and the element needs to have been provided a bus for this to work.
Since: 0.10.18

parameter.name: opts
parameter.parameter_description: the GstMixerOptions whose list of values has changed

function.name: gst_pad_set_getrange_function
function.description: Sets the given getrange function for the pad. The getrange function is called to produce a new #GstBuffer to start the processing pipeline. see #GstPadGetRangeFunction for a description of the getrange function.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_get_pos
function.description: Returns: The current position of @reader in bytes.
function.return:
The current position of @reader in bytes.
Since: 0.10.22

function.name: gst_rtcp_buffer_get_first_packet
function.description: Initialize a new #GstRTCPPacket pointer that points to the first packet in @buffer.
function.return: TRUE if the packet existed in @buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_make_metadata_writable
function.description:
Similar to gst_buffer_make_writable, but does not ensure that the buffer data array is writable. Instead, this just ensures that the returned buffer is solely owned by the caller, by creating a subbuffer of the original buffer if necessary.
After calling this function, @buf should not be referenced anymore. The result of this function has guaranteed writable metadata.
function.return: A new #GstBuffer with writable metadata.

function.name: gst_sdp_media_free
function.description: Free all resources allocated by @media. @media should not be used anymore after this function. This function should be used when @media was dynamically allocated with gst_sdp_media_new().
function.return: a #GstSDPResult.

function.name: gst_base_sink_set_ts_offset
function.description:
Adjust the synchronisation of @sink with @offset. A negative value will render buffers earlier than their timestamp. A positive value will delay rendering. This function can be used to fix playback of badly timestamped buffers.
Since: 0.10.15

function.name: gst_pad_peer_query
function.description:
Performs gst_pad_query() on the peer of @pad.
The caller is responsible for both the allocation and deallocation of the query structure.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to invoke the peer query on.

function.return:
TRUE if the query could be performed. This function returns %FALSE if @pad has no peer.
Since: 0.10.15

function.name: gst_ring_buffer_samples_done
function.description: Get the number of samples that were processed by the ringbuffer since it was last started. This does not include the number of samples not yet processed (see gst_ring_buffer_delay()).
function.return:
The number of samples processed by the ringbuffer.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_tag_setter_add_tag_valist_values
function.description: Adds the given tag / GValue pairs on the setter using the given merge mode. The list must be terminated with NULL.

function.name: gst_ring_buffer_is_acquired

TRUE if the ringbuffer is acquired, FALSE on error.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_sdp_message_dump
function.description: Dump the parsed contents of @msg to stdout.
function.return: a #GstSDPResult.

function.name: gst_clock_id_unschedule
function.description:
Cancel an outstanding request with @id. This can either be an outstanding async notification or a pending sync notification. After this call, @id cannot be used anymore to receive sync or async notifications, you need to create a new #GstClockID.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_rtsp_watch_attach
function.description: Adds a #GstRTSPWatch to a context so that it will be executed within that context.

the ID (greater than 0) for the watch within the GMainContext.

function.return: a #GstSDPResult.

function.description: Called by elements implementing the #GstTuner interface when the current channel changes. Fires the #GstTuner::channel-changed signal.

function.name: gst_bus_create_watch
function.description: Create watch for this bus. The GSource will be dispatched whenever a message is on the bus. After the GSource is dispatched, the message is popped off the bus and unreffed.

parameter.name: bus
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstBus to create the watch for

function.return: A #GSource that can be added to a mainloop.

function.description: Gets the value that is a member of the array contained in @value and has the index @index.

parameter.name: index
parameter.parameter_description: index of value to get from the array

function.return: the value at the given index

function.name: gst_interpolation_control_source_set_from_list
function.description: Sets multiple timed values at once.
function.return: FALSE if the values couldn't be set, TRUE otherwise.

function.name: gst_pad_proxy_setcaps
function.description: Calls gst_pad_set_caps() for every other pad belonging to the same element as @pad. If gst_pad_set_caps() fails on any pad, the proxy setcaps fails. May be used only during negotiation.
function.return: TRUE if sucessful

function.name: gst_segment_to_running_time
function.description:
Translate @position to the total running time using the currently configured and previously accumulated segments. Position is a value between @segment start and stop time.
This function is typically used by elements that need to synchronize to the global clock in a pipeline. The runnning time is a constantly increasing value starting from 0. When gst_segment_init() is called, this value will reset to 0.
This function returns -1 if the position is outside of @segment start and stop.
function.return: the position as the total running time or -1 when an invalid position was given.

function.name: gst_pipeline_get_delay
function.description: Get the configured delay (see gst_pipeline_set_delay()).
function.return:
The configured delay.
MT safe.
Since: 0.10.5

function.name: gst_element_class_set_details
function.description:
Sets the detailed information for a #GstElementClass. <note>This function is for use in _base_init functions only.</note>
The @details are copied.

function.name: gst_tuner_set_frequency
function.description:
Sets a tuning frequency on the given tuner/channel. Note that this requires the given channel to be a "tuning" channel, which can be checked using GST_TUNER_CHANNEL_HAS_FLAG (), with the proper flag being GST_TUNER_CHANNEL_FREQUENCY.
The frequency is in Hz, with minimum steps indicated by the frequency_multiplicator provided in the #GstTunerChannel. The valid range is provided in the min_frequency and max_frequency properties of the #GstTunerChannel.

parameter.name: tuner
parameter.parameter_description: The #Gsttuner (a #GstElement) that owns the given channel.

parameter.name: channel
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstTunerChannel to set the frequency on.

parameter.name: frequency
parameter.parameter_description: The frequency to tune in to.

function.name: gst_ring_buffer_may_start
function.description:
Tell the ringbuffer that it is allowed to start playback when the ringbuffer is filled with samples.
Since: 0.10.6
MT safe.

function.name: gst_tag_list_foreach
function.description: Calls the given function for each tag inside the tag list. Note that if there is no tag, the function won't be called at all.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: function to be called for each tag

function.description: Look up a #GstTunerChannel by name.

parameter.name: channel
parameter.parameter_description: A string containing the name of a #GstTunerChannel

Create a new buffersize event. The event is sent downstream and notifies elements that they should provide a buffer of the specified dimensions.

function.name: gst_video_parse_caps_framerate

This function can be used with #GstCaps that have any media type; it is not limited to formats handled by #GstVideoFormat.

function.name: gst_registry_fork_set_enabled
function.description:
Applications might want to disable/enable the usage of fork() when rebuilding the registry. See gst_registry_fork_is_enabled() for more information.
On platforms without fork(), this function will have no effect on the return value of gst_registry_fork_is_enabled().
Since: 0.10.10

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.parameter_description: whether rebuilding the registry may fork

function.name: gst_tuner_signal_strength
function.description:
Get the strength of the signal on this channel. Note that this requires the current channel to be a "tuning" channel, i.e. a channel on which frequency can be set. This can be checked using GST_TUNER_CHANNEL_HAS_FLAG (), and the appropriate flag to check for is GST_TUNER_CHANNEL_FREQUENCY.
The valid range of the signal strength is indicated in the min_signal and max_signal properties of the #GstTunerChannel.

parameter.name: tuner
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstTuner (a #GstElement) that owns the given channel.

parameter.name: channel
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstTunerChannel to get the signal strength from.

function.return: Signal strength, or 0 on error.

function.name: gst_pad_set_bufferalloc_function
function.description: Sets the given bufferalloc function for the pad. Note that the bufferalloc function can only be set on sinkpads.

function.name: gst_video_format_is_yuv
function.description:
Determine whether the video format is a YUV format.
Since: 0.10.16
function.return: TRUE if @format represents YUV video

function.name: gst_element_no_more_pads
function.description:
Use this function to signal that the element does not expect any more pads to show up in the current pipeline. This function should be called whenever pads have been added by the element itself. Elements with #GST_PAD_SOMETIMES pad templates use this in combination with autopluggers to figure out that the element is done initializing its pads.
This function emits the #GstElement::no-more-pads signal.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_set_chain_function
function.description: Sets the given chain function for the pad. The chain function is called to process a #GstBuffer input buffer. see #GstPadChainFunction for more details.

function.name: gst_pad_iterate_internal_links_default
function.description:
Iterate the list of pads to which the given pad is linked to inside of the parent element. This is the default handler, and thus returns an iterator of all of the pads inside the parent element with opposite direction.
The caller must free this iterator after use with gst_iterator_free().

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to get the internal links of.

function.return:
a #GstIterator of #GstPad, or NULL if @pad has no parent. Unref each returned pad with gst_object_unref().
Since: 0.10.21

function.name: gst_message_parse_info
function.description:
Extracts the GError and debug string from the GstMessage. The values returned in the output arguments are copies; the caller must free them when done.
MT safe.
Since: 0.10.12

parameter.name: debug
parameter.parameter_description: Location for the debug message, or NULL

function.name: gst_tag_freeform_string_to_utf8
function.description: Convenience function to read a string with unknown character encoding. If the string is already in UTF-8 encoding, it will be returned right away. Otherwise, the environment will be searched for a number of environment variables (whose names are specified in the NULL-terminated string array @env_vars) containing a list of character encodings to try/use. If none are specified, the current locale will be tried. If that also doesn't work, ISO-8859-1 is assumed (which will almost always succeed).

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: length of string data, or -1 if the string is NUL-terminated

parameter.name: env_vars
parameter.parameter_description: a NULL-terminated string array of environment variable names, or NULL

function.return:
a newly-allocated string in UTF-8 encoding, or NULL
Since: 0.10.13

function.name: gst_parse_launch
function.description: Create a new pipeline based on command line syntax. Please note that you might get a return value that is not %NULL even though the @error is set. In this case there was a recoverable parsing error and you can try to play the pipeline.

parameter.name: pipeline_description
parameter.parameter_description: the command line describing the pipeline

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: the error message in case of an erroneous pipeline.

function.return: a new element on success, %NULL on failure. If more than one toplevel element is specified by the @pipeline_description, all elements are put into a #GstPipeline, which than is returned.

function.name: gst_base_audio_sink_set_provide_clock
function.description:
Controls whether @sink will provide a clock or not. If @provide is %TRUE, gst_element_provide_clock() will return a clock that reflects the datarate of @sink. If @provide is %FALSE, gst_element_provide_clock() will return NULL.
Since: 0.10.16

function.name: gst_element_is_locked_state
function.description:
Checks if the state of an element is locked. If the state of an element is locked, state changes of the parent don't affect the element. This way you can leave currently unused elements inside bins. Just lock their state before changing the state from #GST_STATE_NULL.
MT safe.
function.return: TRUE, if the element's state is locked.

function.name: gst_value_set_structure
function.description:
Sets the contents of @value to @structure. The actual
Since: 0.10.15

parameter.name: structure
parameter.parameter_description: the structure to set the value to

function.description: Gets the number of values contained in @value.
function.return: the number of values

function.description: Creates a new pad with the given name from the given static template. If name is NULL, a guaranteed unique name (across all pads) will be assigned. This function makes a copy of the name so you can safely free the name.
function.return: a new #GstPad, or NULL in case of an error.

function.name: gst_tag_id3_genre_get
function.description: Gets the ID3v1 genre name for a given ID.
function.return: the genre or NULL if no genre is associated with that ID.

function.name: gst_pad_get_caps
function.description: Gets the capabilities this pad can produce or consume. Note that this method doesn't necessarily return the caps set by gst_pad_set_caps() - use GST_PAD_CAPS() for that instead. gst_pad_get_caps returns all possible caps a pad can operate with, using the pad's get_caps function; this returns the pad template caps if not explicitly set.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to get the capabilities of.

function.return:
a newly allocated copy of the #GstCaps of this pad.
MT safe.

function.description: Sets the int pointed to by @value corresponding to the value of the given field. Caller is responsible for making sure the field exists, has the correct type and that the enumtype is correct.

parameter.parameter_description: the enum type of a field

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to an int to set

function.return: TRUE if the value could be set correctly. If there was no field with @fieldname or the existing field did not contain an enum of the given type, this function returns FALSE.

function.name: gst_element_get_base_time
function.description: Returns: the base time of the element.
function.return:
the base time of the element.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_extension
function.description: Check if the extension bit is set on the RTP packet in @buffer.
function.return: TRUE if @buffer has the extension bit set.

function.name: gst_object_default_deep_notify
function.description:
A default deep_notify signal callback for an object. The user data should contain a pointer to an array of strings that should be excluded from the notify. The default handler will print the new value of the property using g_print.
MT safe. This function grabs and releases @object's LOCK for getting its path string.

parameter.name: excluded_props
parameter.parameter_description: a set of user-specified properties to exclude or NULL to show all changes.

function.name: gst_sdp_media_get_format
function.description: Get the format information at position @idx in @media.
function.return: the format at position @idx.

function.name: gst_base_sink_wait_eos
function.description:
This function will block until @time is reached. It is usually called by subclasses that use their own internal synchronisation but want to let the EOS be handled by the base class.
This function should only be called with the PREROLL_LOCK held, like when receiving an EOS event in the ::event vmethod.
The @time argument should be the running_time of when the EOS should happen and will be adjusted with any latency and offset configured in the sink.
Since 0.10.15

parameter.name: jitter
parameter.parameter_description: the jitter to be filled with time diff (can be NULL)

function.return: #GstFlowReturn

function.name: gst_segment_init
function.description:
The start/last_stop positions are set to 0 and the stop/duration fields are set to -1 (unknown). The default rate of 1.0 and no flags are set.
Initialize @segment to its default values.

function.name: gst_controller_get_value_arrays
function.description:
Function to be able to get an array of values for one or more given element properties.
All fields of the %GstValueArray in the list must be filled correctly. Especially the GstValueArray->values arrays must be big enough to keep the requested amount of values.
The types of the values in the array are the same as the property's type.
<note><para>This doesn't modify the controlled GObject properties!</para></note>

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the controller that handles the values

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the time that should be processed

parameter.name: value_arrays
parameter.parameter_description: list to return the control-values in

function.return: %TRUE if the given array(s) could be filled, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gst_structure_get_clock_time
function.description: Sets the clock time pointed to by @value corresponding to the clock time of the given field. Caller is responsible for making sure the field exists and has the correct type.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a #GstClockTime to set

function.return: TRUE if the value could be set correctly. If there was no field with @fieldname or the existing field did not contain a #GstClockTime, this function returns FALSE.

function.name: gst_object_get_control_rate
function.description:
Obtain the control-rate for this @object. Audio processing #GstElement objects will use this rate to sub-divide their processing loop and call gst_object_sync_values() inbetween. The length of the processing segment should be up to @control-rate nanoseconds.
If the @object is not under property control, this will return %GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE. This allows the element to avoid the sub-dividing.
The control-rate is not expected to change if the element is in %GST_STATE_PAUSED or %GST_STATE_PLAYING.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that has controlled properties

function.return: the control rate in nanoseconds Since: 0.10.10

function.name: gst_element_link
function.description:
Links @src to @dest. The link must be from source to destination; the other direction will not be tried. The function looks for existing pads that aren't linked yet. It will request new pads if necessary. Such pads need to be released manualy when unlinking. If multiple links are possible, only one is established.
Make sure you have added your elements to a bin or pipeline with gst_bin_add() before trying to link them.
function.return: TRUE if the elements could be linked, FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_netaddress_set_address_bytes
function.description: Set just the address bytes stored in @naddr into @address.

parameter.name: address
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the result.

parameter.name: port
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the port.

function.return:
number of bytes actually copied
Since: 0.10.22

function.name: GstChildProxy
function.description: Will be emitted after the @object was removed from the @child_proxy.

function.name: gst_value_intersect
function.description: Calculates the intersection of two values. If the values have a non-empty intersection, the value representing the intersection is placed in @dest. If the intersection is non-empty, @dest is not modified.

parameter.name: dest
parameter.parameter_description: a uninitialized #GValue that will hold the calculated intersection value

function.return: TRUE if the intersection is non-empty

function.name: gst_fft_s32_new
function.description:
This returns a new #GstFFTS32 instance with the given parameters. It makes sense to keep one instance for several calls for speed reasons.
@len must be even and to get the best performance a product of 2, 3 and 5. To get the next number with this characteristics use gst_fft_next_fast_length().

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: Length of the FFT in the time domain

parameter.name: inverse
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the #GstFFTS32 instance should be used for the inverse FFT

function.return: a new #GstFFTS32 instance.

function.name: gst_buffer_straw_stop_pipeline
function.description:
Set @bin to #GST_STATE_NULL and release resource allocated in gst_buffer_straw_start_pipeline().
You must have previously called gst_buffer_straw_start_pipeline() on @pipeline and @pad.

parameter.name: bin
parameter.parameter_description: the pipeline previously started via gst_buffer_straw_start_pipeline()

parameter.name: pad

function.name: gst_element_link_pads

parameter.parameter_description: the name of the #GstPad in source element or NULL for any pad.

parameter.name: destpadname
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the #GstPad in destination element, or NULL for any pad.

function.return: TRUE if the pads could be linked, FALSE otherwise.

parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to get the clock of.

function.return:
the #GstClock of the element. unref after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_get_count
function.description: Get the count field in @packet.
function.return: The count field in @packet or -1 if @packet does not point to a valid packet.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_set_packet_len
function.description: Set the total @buffer size to @len. The data in the buffer will be made larger if needed. Any padding will be removed from the packet.

function.name: gst_property_probe_get_values

function.return: A list of valid values for the given property.

The remaining number of bytes of @reader instance.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_remove_header
function.description: Remove the @indx header with key @field from @msg. If @indx equals -1, all headers will be removed.
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_task_pause
function.description: Pauses @task. This method can also be called on a task in the stopped state, in which case a thread will be started and will remain in the paused state. This function does not wait for the task to complete the paused state.
function.return:
%TRUE if the task could be paused.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_base_audio_src_set_provide_clock
function.description:
Controls whether @src will provide a clock or not. If @provide is %TRUE, gst_element_provide_clock() will return a clock that reflects the datarate of @src. If @provide is %FALSE, gst_element_provide_clock() will return NULL.
Since: 0.10.16

function.name: gst_riff_parse_strf_iavs
function.description: Parses a interleaved (also known as "complex") streams strf structure plus optionally some extradata from input data. This function takes ownership of @buf.

parameter.name: strf
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer (returned by this function) to a filled-in strf/iavs structure. Caller should free it.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer (returned by this function) to a buffer containing extradata for this particular stream (e.g. codec initialization data).

function.return: TRUE if parsing succeeded, otherwise FALSE.

function.name: gst_ring_buffer_read
function.description:
Read @len samples from the ringbuffer into the memory pointed to by @data. The first sample should be read from position @sample in the ringbuffer.
@len should not be a multiple of the segment size of the ringbuffer although it is recommended.

parameter.name: sample
parameter.parameter_description: the sample position of the data

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: where the data should be read

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: the number of samples in data to read

function.return:
The number of samples read from the ringbuffer or -1 on error.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_task_get_state

The #GstTaskState of the task

function.name: gst_debug_set_threshold_for_name

function.name: GstPipeline
function.description:
Whether or not to automatically flush all messages on the pipeline's bus when going from READY to NULL state. Please see gst_pipeline_set_auto_flush_bus() for more information on this option.
Since: 0.10.4

parameter.name: strh
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to the strh stream header structure.

parameter.name: strf
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to the strf stream header structure, including any data that is within the range of strf.size, but excluding any additional data withint this chunk but outside strf.size.

parameter.name: strf_data
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstBuffer containing the additional data in the strf chunk outside reach of strf.size. Ususally a palette.

parameter.parameter_description: if given, will be filled with a human-readable codec name.

function.name: gst_iterator_push
function.description:
Pushes @other iterator onto @it. All calls performed on @it are forwarded to @other. If @other returns #GST_ITERATOR_DONE, it is popped again and calls are handled by @it again.
This function is mainly used by objects implementing the iterator next function to recurse into substructures.
When gst_iterator_resync() is called on @it, @other will automatically be popped.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_caps_new_any

function.name: gst_debug_set_default_threshold

function.name: gst_event_new_latency

Create a new latency event. The event is sent upstream from the sinks and notifies elements that they should add an additional @latency to the timestamps before synchronising against the clock.
The latency is mostly used in live sinks and is always expressed in the time format.
function.return:
a new #GstEvent
Since: 0.10.12

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_sdes_get_entry
function.description:
Get the data of the current SDES item entry. @type (when not NULL) will contain the type of the entry. @data (when not NULL) will point to @len bytes.
When @type refers to a text item, @data will point to a UTF8 string. Note that this UTF8 string is NOT null-terminated. Use gst_rtcp_packet_sdes_copy_entry() to get a null-termined copy of the entry.

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: result length of the entry data

function.return: %TRUE if there was valid data.

function.name: gst_bus_pop

The #GstMessage that is on the bus, or NULL if the bus is empty. The message is taken from the bus and needs to be unreffed with gst_message_unref() after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_base_src_query_latency
function.description:
Query the source for the latency parameters. @live will be TRUE when @src is configured as a live source. @min_latency will be set to the difference between the running time and the timestamp of the first buffer. @max_latency is always the undefined value of -1.
This function is mostly used by subclasses.

parameter.name: min_latency
parameter.parameter_description: the min latency of the source

parameter.name: max_latency
parameter.parameter_description: the max latency of the source

function.return:
TRUE if the query succeeded.
Since: 0.10.13

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_ext_timestamp
function.description:
Update the @exttimestamp field with @timestamp. For the first call of the method, @exttimestamp should point to a location with a value of -1.
This function makes sure that the returned value is a constantly increasing value even in the case where there is a timestamp wraparound.
function.return:
The extended timestamp of @timestamp.
Since: 0.10.15

function.name: gst_rtsp_watch_free
function.description:
Decreases the reference count of @watch by one. If the resulting reference count is zero the watch and associated memory will be destroyed.

function.name: gst_task_join

Joins @task. After this call, it is safe to unref the task and clean up the lock set with gst_task_set_lock().
The task will automatically be stopped with this call.
This function cannot be called from within a task function as this would cause a deadlock. The function will detect this and print a g_warning.

%TRUE if the task could be joined.

It's also possible that the list changes while handling the pads, which the caller of this function is unable to know. Use the thread-safe gst_pad_iterate_internal_links() instead.

function.description: This is a convenience wrapper around gst_parse_launch() to create a #GstBin from a gst-launch-style pipeline description. See gst_parse_launch() and the gst-launch man page for details about the syntax. Ghost pads on the bin for unlinked source or sink pads within the bin can automatically be created (but only a maximum of one ghost pad for each direction will be created; if you expect multiple unlinked source pads or multiple unlinked sink pads and want them all ghosted, you will have to create the ghost pads yourself).

function.name: gst_collect_pads_add_pad_full
function.description:
Add a pad to the collection of collect pads. The pad has to be a sinkpad. The refcount of the pad is incremented. Use gst_collect_pads_remove_pad() to remove the pad from the collection again.
You specify a size for the returned #GstCollectData structure so that you can use it to store additional information.
You can also specify a #GstCollectDataDestroyNotify that will be called just before the #GstCollectData structure is freed. It is passed the pointer to the structure and should free any custom memory and resources allocated for it.
The pad will be automatically activated in push mode when @pads is started.
Since: 0.10.12

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the size of the returned #GstCollectData structure

parameter.name: destroy_notify
parameter.parameter_description: function to be called before the returned #GstCollectData structure is freed

function.return:
a new #GstCollectData to identify the new pad. Or NULL if wrong parameters are supplied.
MT safe.

function.description:
When @pad is flushing this function returns #GST_FLOW_WRONG_STATE immediatly.
Calls the getrange function of @pad, see #GstPadGetRangeFunction for a description of a getrange function. If @pad has no getrange function installed (see gst_pad_set_getrange_function()) this function returns #GST_FLOW_NOT_SUPPORTED.
This is a lowlevel function. Usualy gst_pad_pull_range() is used.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: The start offset of the buffer

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to hold the #GstBuffer, returns #GST_FLOW_ERROR if %NULL.

function.return:
a #GstFlowReturn from the pad.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_iterator_new_list
function.description:
Create a new iterator designed for iterating @list.
The list you iterate is usually part of a data structure @owner and is protected with @lock.
The iterator will use @lock to retrieve the next item of the list and it will then call the @item function before releasing @lock again.
The @item function usualy makes sure that the item remains alive while @lock is released and the application is using the item. The application is responsible for freeing/unreffing the item after usage as explained in gst_iterator_next().
When a concurrent update to the list is performed, usually by @owner while holding @lock, @master_cookie will be updated. The iterator implementation will notice the update of the cookie and will return #GST_ITERATOR_RESYNC to the user of the iterator in the next call to gst_iterator_next().
@owner will be passed to the @free function when the iterator is freed.

parameter.name: lock
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a #GMutex protecting the list.

parameter.name: master_cookie
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a guint32 that is incremented when the list is changed.

parameter.name: item
parameter.parameter_description: function to call for each item

parameter.name: free
parameter.parameter_description: function to call when the iterator is freed

function.return:
the new #GstIterator for @list.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_pad_to
gst_pad_dispatcher
function.description: Invokes the given dispatcher function on each respective peer of all pads that are internally linked to the given pad. The GstPadDispatcherFunction should return TRUE when no further pads need to be processed.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: gpointer user data passed to the dispatcher function.

function.return: TRUE if one of the dispatcher functions returned TRUE.

function.name: gst_index_entry_free
function.description: Free the memory used by the given entry.

function.name: gst_control_source_bind
function.description: Binds a #GstControlSource to a specific property. This must be called only once for a #GstControlSource.

parameter.name: pspec
parameter.parameter_description: #GParamSpec for the property for which this #GstControlSource should generate values.

function.return: %TRUE if the #GstControlSource was bound correctly, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_fft_s32_fft

parameter.name: timedata
parameter.parameter_description: Buffer of the samples in the time domain

parameter.name: freqdata
parameter.parameter_description: Target buffer for the samples in the frequency domain

function.name: gst_pipeline_auto_clock
function.description:
Let @pipeline select a clock automatically. This is the default behaviour.
Use this function if you previous forced a fixed clock with gst_pipeline_use_clock() and want to restore the default pipeline clock selection algorithm.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_base_rtp_depayload_push_ts
function.description:
Push @out_buf to the peer of @filter. This function takes ownership of @out_buf.
Unlike gst_base_rtp_depayload_push(), this function will apply @timestamp on the outgoing buffer, using the configured clock_rate to convert the timestamp to a valid GStreamer clock time.
function.return: a #GstFlowReturn.

function.name: gst_collect_pads_take_buffer
function.description:
Get a subbuffer of @size bytes from the given pad @data. Flushes the amount of read bytes.
This function should be called with @pads LOCK held, such as in the callback.
Since: 0.10.18

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to read

function.return:
A sub buffer. The size of the buffer can be less that requested. A return of NULL signals that the pad is end-of-stream. Unref the buffer after use.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_element_factory_get_element_type
function.description: Get the #GType for elements managed by this factory. The type can only be retrieved if the element factory is loaded, which can be assured with gst_plugin_feature_load().
function.return: the #GType for elements managed by this factory or 0 if the factory is not loaded.

function.name: gst_uri_get_location
function.description: Extracts the location out of a given valid URI, ie. the protocol and "://" are stripped from the URI, which means that the location returned includes the hostname if one is specified. The returned string must be freed using g_free().
function.return: The location for this URI. Returns NULL if the URI isn't valid. If the URI does not contain a location, an empty string is returned.

function.name: gst_index_get_group
function.description: Get the id of the current group.

parameter.name: index
parameter.parameter_description: the index to get the current group from

function.return: the id of the current group.

function.name: gst_update_registry
function.description:
Forces GStreamer to re-scan its plugin paths and update the default plugin registry.
Applications will almost never need to call this function, it is only useful if the application knows new plugins have been installed (or old ones removed) since the start of the application (or, to be precise, the first call to gst_init()) and the application wants to make use of any newly-installed plugins without restarting the application.
Applications should assume that the registry update is neither atomic nor thread-safe and should therefore not have any dynamic pipelines running (including the playbin and decodebin elements) and should also not create any elements or access the GStreamer registry while the update is in progress.
Note that this function may block for a significant amount of time.
function.return:
%TRUE if the registry has been updated successfully (does not imply that there were changes), otherwise %FALSE.
Since: 0.10.12

function.name: gst_plugin_add_dependency_simple
function.description:
Make GStreamer aware of external dependencies which affect the feature set of this plugin (ie. the elements or typefinders associated with it).
GStreamer will re-inspect plugins with external dependencies whenever any of the external dependencies change. This is useful for plugins which wrap other plugin systems, e.g. a plugin which wraps a plugin-based visualisation library and makes visualisations available as GStreamer elements, or a codec loader which exposes elements and/or caps dependent on what external codec libraries are currently installed.
Convenience wrapper function for gst_plugin_add_dependency() which takes simple strings as arguments instead of string arrays, with multiple arguments separated by predefined delimiters (see above).
Since: 0.10.22

parameter.name: env_vars
parameter.parameter_description: one or more environent variables (separated by ':', ';' or ','), or NULL. Environment variable names may be followed by a path component which will be added to the content of the environment variable, e.g. "HOME/.mystuff/plugins:MYSTUFF_PLUGINS_PATH"

parameter.name: paths
parameter.parameter_description: one ore more directory paths (separated by ':' or ';' or ','), or NULL. Example: "/usr/lib/mystuff/plugins"

parameter.name: names
parameter.parameter_description: one or more file names or file name suffixes (separated by commas), or NULL

function.name: gst_missing_element_message_new
function.description: Creates a missing-plugin message for @element to notify the application that a certain required element is missing. This function is mainly for use in plugins.

parameter.name: factory_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the missing element (element factory), e.g. "videoscale" or "cdparanoiasrc"

function.return: a new #GstMessage, or NULL on error

function.name: gst_bin_get_by_interface
function.description:
Looks for an element inside the bin that implements the given interface. If such an element is found, it returns the element. You can cast this element to the given interface afterwards. If you want all elements that implement the interface, use gst_bin_iterate_all_by_interface(). This function recurses into child bins.
MT safe. Caller owns returned reference.
function.return: A #GstElement inside the bin implementing the interface

function.name: gst_video_format_get_component_offset
function.description:
Calculates the offset (in bytes) of the first pixel of the component with index @component. For packed formats, this will typically be a small integer (0, 1, 2, 3). For planar formats, this will be a (relatively) large offset to the beginning of the second or third component planes. See @gst_video_format_get_row_stride for a description of the component index.
Since: 0.10.16
function.return: offset of component @component

function.name: gst_element_get_query_types
function.description: Get an array of query types from the element. If the element doesn't implement a query types function, the query will be forwarded to the peer of a random linked sink pad.
function.return:
An array of #GstQueryType elements that should not be freed or modified.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_base_sink_set_blocksize
function.description:
Set the number of bytes that the sink will pull when it is operating in pull mode.
Since: 0.10.22

function.name: gst_pad_set_activatepull_function
function.description: Sets the given activate_pull function for the pad. An activate_pull function prepares the element and any upstream connections for pulling. See XXX part-activation.txt for details.

function.name: gst_riff_read_chunk
function.description: Reads a single chunk of data. Since 0.10.8 'JUNK' chunks are skipped automatically.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: offset to pull from, incremented by this function.

parameter.name: tag
parameter.parameter_description: fourcc of the chunk (returned by this function).

function.return: flow status.

function.name: gst_format_register
function.description: Create a new GstFormat based on the nick or return an already registered format with that nick.

parameter.name: nick
parameter.parameter_description: The nick of the new format

parameter.name: description
parameter.parameter_description: The description of the new format

function.return:
A new GstFormat or an already registered format with the same nick.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_debug_construct_term_color
function.description: Constructs a string that can be used for getting the desired color in color terminals. You need to free the string after use.
function.return: a string containing the color definition

function.name: gst_pb_utils_get_codec_description
function.description: Returns: a newly-allocated description string, or NULL on error. Free

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: the (fixed) #GstCaps for which an format description is needed

function.return: a newly-allocated description string, or NULL on error. Free string with g_free() when not needed any longer.

function.name: gst_net_time_provider_new
function.description: Allows network clients to get the current time of @clock.

parameter.name: clock
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstClock to export over the network

parameter.name: address
parameter.parameter_description: an address to bind on as a dotted quad (xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx), or NULL to bind to all addresses

parameter.name: port
parameter.parameter_description: a port to bind on, or 0 to let the kernel choose

function.return: the new #GstNetTimeProvider, or NULL on error

function.name: gst_class_signal_emit_by_name
function.description: emits the named class signal.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the signal to emit

function.name: gst_message_new_async_done
function.description: The message is posted when elements completed an ASYNC state change.
function.return:
The new async_done message.
MT safe.
Since: 0.10.13

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_sr_set_sender_info
function.description: Set the given values in the SR packet @packet.

function.name: gst_install_plugins_context_set_xid
function.description:
This function is for X11-based applications (such as most Gtk/Qt applications on linux/unix) only. You can use it to tell the external installer the XID of your main application window. That way the installer can make its own window transient to your application window during the installation.
If set, the XID will be passed to the installer via a --transient-for=XID command line option.
Gtk+/Gnome application should be able to obtain the XID of the top-level window like this: <programlisting> ##include <gtk/gtk.h> ##ifdef GDK_WINDOWING_X11 ##include <gdk/gdkx.h> ##endif ... ##ifdef GDK_WINDOWING_X11 xid = GDK_WINDOW_XWINDOW (GTK_WIDGET (application_window)->window); ##endif ... </programlisting>
Since: 0.10.12

parameter.name: xid
parameter.parameter_description: the XWindow ID (XID) of the top-level application

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_allocate_data
function.description: Allocate enough data in @buffer to hold an RTP packet with @csrc_count CSRCs, a payload length of @payload_len and padding of @pad_len. MALLOCDATA of @buffer will be overwritten and will not be freed. All other RTP header fields will be set to 0/FALSE.

function.name: gst_audio_set_caps_channel_positions_list
function.description: Sets a (possibly non-fixed) list of possible audio channel positions (given in pos) on the given caps. Each of the structures of the caps, after this function has been called, will contain a "channel-positions" field with an array. Each value in the array will contain each of the values given in the pos array. Note that the size of the caps might be increased by this, since each structure with a "channel- positions" field needs to have a fixed "channels" field. The input caps is not required to have this.

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: #GstCaps to set the list of channel positions on.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.parameter_description: the array containing one or more possible audio channel positions that we should add in each value of the array in the given structure.

parameter.name: num_positions
parameter.parameter_description: the number of values in pos.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_append_headers
function.description: Append the currently configured headers in @msg to the #GString @str suitable for transmission.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.

function.name: gst_value_get_mini_object
function.description: Get the contents of a %GST_TYPE_MINI_OBJECT derived #GValue. Does not increase the refcount of the returned object.
function.return: mini object contents of @value

function.name: gst_byte_reader_get_int16_be
function.description: Read a signed 16 bit big endian integer into @val and update the current position.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #gint16 to store the result

function.return:
%TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.
Since: 0.10.22

function.name: gst_preset_get_meta
function.description: Gets the @value for an existing meta data @tag. Meta data @tag names can be something like e.g. "comment". Returned values need to be released when done.
function.return:
%TRUE for success, %FALSE if e.g. there is no preset with that @name or no value for the given @tag
Since: 0.10.20

function.name: gst_tag_list_from_vorbiscomment_buffer
function.description: Creates a new tag list that contains the information parsed out of a vorbiscomment packet.

parameter.name: id_data
parameter.parameter_description: identification data at start of stream

parameter.name: vendor_string
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a string that should take the vendor string of this vorbis comment or NULL if you don't need it.

function.return: A new #GstTagList with all tags that could be extracted from the given vorbiscomment buffer or NULL on error.

function.name: gst_controller_set
function.description:
Set the value of given controller-handled property at a certain time.
Deprecated: Use #GstControlSource, for example #GstInterpolationControlSource directly.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the controller object which handles the properties

parameter.name: property_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the property to set

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the time the control-change is schedules for

function.return: FALSE if the values couldn't be set (ex : properties not handled by controller), TRUE otherwise

function.name: gst_pad_stop_task
function.description:
Stop the task of @pad. This function will also make sure that the function executed by the task will effectively stop if not called from the GstTaskFunction.
This function will deadlock if called from the GstTaskFunction of the task. Use gst_task_pause() instead.
Regardless of whether the pad has a task, the stream lock is acquired and released so as to ensure that streaming through this pad has finished.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to stop the task of

function.return: a TRUE if the task could be stopped or FALSE on error.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_payload_type
function.description: Get the payload type of the RTP packet in @buffer.
function.return: The payload type.

function.name: gst_poll_write_control
function.description:
Write a byte to the control socket of the controllable @set. This function is mostly usefull for timer #GstPoll objects created with gst_poll_new_timer().
It will make any current and future gst_poll_wait() function return with 1, meaning the control socket is set. After an equal amount of calls to gst_poll_read_control() have been performed, calls to gst_poll_wait() will block again until their timeout expired.
function.return:
%TRUE on success. %FALSE when @set is not controllable or when the byte could not be written.
Since: 0.10.23

function.name: gst_object_get_name
function.description: Returns: the name of @object. g_free() after usage.
function.return:
the name of @object. g_free() after usage.
MT safe. This function grabs and releases @object's LOCK.

function.name: gst_message_parse_state_changed
function.description:
Extracts the old and new states from the GstMessage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_interpolation_control_source_new
function.description: This returns a new, unbound #GstInterpolationControlSource.
function.return: a new, unbound #GstInterpolationControlSource.

function.name: gst_pad_get_negotiated_caps
function.description:
Gets the capabilities of the media type that currently flows through @pad and its peer.
This function can be used on both src and sinkpads. Note that srcpads are always negotiated before sinkpads so it is possible that the negotiated caps on the srcpad do not match the negotiated caps of the peer.
function.return:
the negotiated #GstCaps of the pad link. Unref the caps when you no longer need it. This function returns NULL when the @pad has no peer or is not negotiated yet.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_iterator_free
function.description:
Free the iterator.
MT safe.

function.name: read_packet_header
function.description: Read the packet headers for the packet pointed to by @packet.
function.return: TRUE if @packet pointed to a valid header.

function.name: GstURIHandler
function.description: The URI of the given @handler has changed.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.parameter_description: The new URI, or NULL if the URI was removed

function.name: gst_controller_remove_properties_list
function.description: Removes the given object properties from the controller

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the controller object from which some properties should be removed

parameter.name: list
parameter.parameter_description: #GList of property names that should be removed

function.return: %FALSE if one of the given property isn't handled by the controller, %TRUE otherwise

function.name: gst_pad_get_internal_links_default
function.description:
Gets a list of pads to which the given pad is linked to inside of the parent element. This is the default handler, and thus returns a list of all of the pads inside the parent element with opposite direction.
The caller must free this list after use with g_list_free().

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to get the internal links of.

function.return:
a newly allocated #GList of pads, or NULL if the pad has no parent.
Not MT safe.
Deprecated: This function does not ref the pads in the list so that they could become invalid by the time the application accesses them. It's also possible that the list changes while handling the pads, which the caller of this function is unable to know. Use the thread-safe gst_pad_iterate_internal_links_default() instead.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_parse_response

parameter.name: code
parameter.parameter_description: location to hold the status code

parameter.name: reason
parameter.parameter_description: location to hold the status reason

function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_object_set_control_source
function.description: Sets the #GstControlSource for @property_name. If there already was a #GstControlSource for this property it will be unreferenced.

parameter.name: property_name
parameter.parameter_description: name of the property for which the #GstControlSource should be set

parameter.name: csource
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstControlSource that should be used for the property

function.return:
%FALSE if the given property isn't handled by the controller or the new #GstControlSource couldn't be bound to the property, %TRUE if everything worked as expected.
Since: 0.10.14

function.name: gst_byte_reader_peek_int64_le
function.description: Read a signed 64 bit little endian integer into @val but keep the current position.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #gint64 to store the result

function.return:
%TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.
Since: 0.10.22

function.name: gst_plugin_feature_set_name
function.description: Sets the name of a plugin feature. The name uniquely identifies a feature within all features of the same type. Renaming a plugin feature is not allowed. A copy is made of the name so you should free the supplied @name after calling this function.

function.name: gst_object_set_parent
function.description:
Sets the parent of @object to @parent. The object's reference count will be incremented, and any floating reference will be removed (see gst_object_sink()).
This function causes the parent-set signal to be emitted when the parent was successfully set.
function.return:
TRUE if @parent could be set or FALSE when @object already had a parent or @object and @parent are the same.
MT safe. Grabs and releases @object's LOCK.

function.name: gst_poll_fd_ctl_write
function.description: Control whether the descriptor @fd in @set will be monitored for writability.
function.return:
%TRUE if the descriptor was successfully updated.
Since: 0.10.18

function.name: gst_query_new_application
function.description: Constructs a new custom application query object. Use gst_query_unref() when done with it.
function.return: a #GstQuery

function.name: gst_poll_fd_ignored
function.description:
Mark @fd as ignored so that the next call to gst_poll_wait() will yield the same result for @fd as last time. This function must be called if no operation (read/write/recv/send/etc.) will be performed on @fd before the next call to gst_poll_wait().
The reason why this is needed is because the underlying implementation might not allow querying the fd more than once between calls to one of the re-enabling operations.
Since: 0.10.18

function.name: gst_tag_list_get_boolean_index
function.description: Gets the value that is at the given index for the given tag in the given list.

parameter.name: list
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstTagList to get the tag from

parameter.name: index
parameter.parameter_description: number of entry to read out

function.return: TRUE, if a value was copied, FALSE if the tag didn't exist in the given list.

function.name: gst_pad_activate_pull
function.description:
Activates or deactivates the given pad in pull mode via dispatching to the pad's activatepullfunc. For use from within pad activation functions only. When called on sink pads, will first proxy the call to the peer pad, which is expected to activate its internally linked pads from within its activate_pull function.
If you don't know what this is, you probably don't want to call it.

parameter.name: active
parameter.parameter_description: whether or not the pad should be active.

function.return:
TRUE if the operation was successful.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_missing_element_installer_detail_new
function.description: Returns: a newly-allocated detail string, or NULL on error. Free string

parameter.name: factory_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the missing element (element factory), e.g. "videoscale" or "cdparanoiasrc"

function.return:
a newly-allocated detail string, or NULL on error. Free string with g_free() when not needed any longer.

Attempt to send @message to the connected @conn, blocking up to the specified @timeout. @timeout can be #NULL, in which case this function might block forever.
This function can be cancelled with gst_rtsp_connection_flush().
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK on success.

function.return:

function.description: Create a new #GstRTSPMessage with @method and @uri and store the result request message in @msg. Free with gst_rtsp_message_free().
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_byte_reader_get_int16_le
function.description: Read a signed 16 bit little endian integer into @val and update the current position.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #gint16 to store the result

function.return:
%TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.
Since: 0.10.22

function.name: gst_value_register_intersect_func
function.description:
Registers a function that is called to calculate the intersection of the values having the types @type1 and @type2.
Intersect functions should be registered at startup before any pipelines are started, as gst_value_register_intersect_func() is not thread-safe and cannot be used at the same time as gst_value_intersect() or gst_value_can_intersect().

function.name: gst_pad_set_active
function.description:
Activates or deactivates the given pad. Normally called from within core state change functions.
If @active, makes sure the pad is active. If it is already active, either in push or pull mode, just return. Otherwise dispatches to the pad's activate function to perform the actual activation.
If not @active, checks the pad's current mode and calls gst_pad_activate_push() or gst_pad_activate_pull(), as appropriate, with a FALSE argument.

parameter.name: active
parameter.parameter_description: whether or not the pad should be active.

function.return:
#TRUE if the operation was successful.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_fft_s16_free
function.description: This frees the memory allocated for @self.

function.name: gst_clock_id_unref
function.description:
Unref given @id. When the refcount reaches 0 the #GstClockID will be freed.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_buffer_merge
function.description:
Create a new buffer that is the concatenation of the two source buffers. The original source buffers will not be modified or unref'd. Make sure you unref the source buffers if they are not used anymore afterwards.
If the buffers point to contiguous areas of memory, the buffer is created without copying the data.
function.return: the new #GstBuffer which is the concatenation of the source buffers.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_get_bits_uint64
function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val and update the current position.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #guint64 to store the result

function.return:
%TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.
Since: 0.10.22

function.name: gst_rtsp_strresult
function.description: Convert @result in a human readable string.
function.return: a newly allocated string. g_free() after usage.

function.name: gst_element_implements_interface
function.description: Test whether the given element implements a certain interface of type iface_type, and test whether it is supported for this specific instance.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: #GstElement to check for the implementation of the interface

parameter.name: iface_type
parameter.parameter_description: (final) type of the interface which we want to be implemented

function.return: whether or not the element implements the interface.

function.name: gst_rtsp_message_unset
function.description: Unset the concents of @msg so that it becomes an uninitialized #GstRTSPMessage again. This function is mostly used in combination with gst_rtsp_message_init_request(), gst_rtsp_message_init_response() and gst_rtsp_message_init_data() on stack allocated #GstRTSPMessage structures.
function.return: #GST_RTSP_OK.
