function.description: Retrieves a pad from @element by name. This version only retrieves already-existing (i.e. 'static') pads.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to find a static pad of.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the static #GstPad to retrieve.

function.return:
the requested #GstPad if found, otherwise %NULL. unref after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_base_rtp_depayload_push
function.description:
Push @out_buf to the peer of @filter. This function takes ownership of @out_buf.
Unlike gst_base_rtp_depayload_push_ts(), this function will not apply any timestamp on the outgoing buffer.
function.return: a #GstFlowReturn.

function.name: gst_collect_pads_start
function.description:
Starts the processing of data in the collect_pads.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_set_query_type_function
function.description: Set the given query type function for the pad.

function.name: gst_mixer_message_parse_option_changed
function.description:
Extracts the GstMixerOptions and new value from a option-changed bus notification message.
The options and value returned remain valid until the message is freed.
Since: 0.10.14

parameter.name: options
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to hold a GstMixerOptions object, or NULL.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: Result location to receive the new options value, or NULL.

function.name: gst_collect_pads_is_active
function.description:
Check if a pad is active.
This function is currently not implemented.
function.return:
%TRUE if the pad is active.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_sdp_message_uninit
function.description: Free all resources allocated in @msg. @msg should not be used anymore after this function. This function should be used when @msg was allocated on the stack and initialized with gst_sdp_message_init().
function.return: a #GstSDPResult.

function.name: gst_tuner_list_channels
function.description: Retrieve a #GList of #GstTunerChannels available (e.g. 'composite', 's-video', ...) from the given tuner object.

parameter.name: tuner
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstTuner (a #GstElement) to get the channels from.

function.return: A list of channels available on this tuner. The list is owned by the GstTuner and must not be freed.

function.name: gst_query_set_formatsv
function.description:
Set the formats query result fields in @query. The number of formats passed in the @formats array must be equal to @n_formats.
Since: 0.10.4

parameter.name: n_formats
parameter.parameter_description: the number of formats to set.

function.name: gst_element_found_tags_for_pad
function.description:
Posts a message to the bus that new tags were found and pushes the tags as event. Takes ownership of the @list.
This is a utility method for elements. Applications should use the #GstTagSetter interface.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: element for which to post taglist to bus.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: pad on which to push tag-event.

parameter.name: list
parameter.parameter_description: the taglist to post on the bus and create event from.

function.name: gst_base_sink_wait_preroll
function.description:
If the #GstBaseSinkClass::render method performs its own synchronisation against the clock it must unblock when going from PLAYING to the PAUSED state and call this method before continuing to render the remaining data.
This function will block until a state change to PLAYING happens (in which case this function returns #GST_FLOW_OK) or the processing must be stopped due to a state change to READY or a FLUSH event (in which case this function Returns: #GST_FLOW_OK if the preroll completed and processing can
function.return: #GST_FLOW_OK if the preroll completed and processing can continue. Any other return value should be returned from the render vmethod.

function.name: gst_interpolation_control_source_get_all
function.description: Returns: a copy of the list, or %NULL if the property isn't handled by the controller

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstInterpolationControlSource to get the list from

function.return: a copy of the list, or %NULL if the property isn't handled by the controller

function.name: gst_sdp_message_zones_len
function.description: Get the number of time zone information entries in @msg.
function.return: the number of time zone information entries in @msg.

function.name: gst_netaddress_set_ip6_address
function.description: Set @naddr with the IPv6 @address and @port pair.

function.name: gst_message_new_warning
function.description: Create a new warning message. The message will make copies of @error and @debug.
function.return:
The new warning message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_info
function.description: Create a new info message. The message will make copies of @error and @debug.
function.return:
The new info message.
Since: 0.10.12
MT safe.

function.name: gst_bin_get_by_name_recurse_up
function.description:
Gets the element with the given name from this bin. If the element is not found, a recursion is performed on the parent bin.
Returns: the #GstElement with the given name, or NULL

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the element name to search for

function.return: the #GstElement with the given name, or NULL

function.name: gst_index_set_filter_full
function.description: Lets the app register a custom filter function so that it can select what entries should be stored in the index.

parameter.name: index
parameter.parameter_description: the index to register the filter on

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: data passed to the filter function

parameter.name: user_data_destroy
parameter.parameter_description: function to call when @user_data is unset

function.name: gst_video_format_parse_caps
function.description:
Determines the #GstVideoFormat of @caps and places it in the location pointed to by @format. Extracts the size of the video and places it in the location pointed to by @width and @height. If @caps does not represent one of the raw video formats listed in #GstVideoFormat, the function will fail and return FALSE.
Since: 0.10.16

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstVideoFormat of the video represented by @caps (output)

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the width of the video represented by @caps, may be NULL (output)

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the height of the video represented by @caps, may be NULL (output)

function.return: TRUE if @caps was parsed correctly.

function.name: gst_rtcp_buffer_validate
function.description: Check if the data pointed to by @buffer is a valid RTCP packet using gst_rtcp_buffer_validate_data().
function.return: TRUE if @buffer is a valid RTCP packet.

function.name: gst_xml_get_topelements
function.description: Retrieve a list of toplevel elements.

parameter.name: xml
parameter.parameter_description: The GstXML to get the elements from

function.return: a GList of top-level elements. The caller does not own a copy of the list and must not free or modify the list. The caller also does not own a reference to any of the elements in the list and should obtain its own reference using gst_object_ref() if necessary.

function.name: gst_element_get_request_pad
function.description: Retrieves a pad from the element by name. This version only retrieves request pads. The pad should be released with gst_element_release_request_pad().

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstElement to find a request pad of.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the request #GstPad to retrieve.

function.return: requested #GstPad if found, otherwise %NULL. Release after usage.

function.name: gst_xml_write_file
function.description: Converts the given element into XML and writes the formatted XML to an open file.
function.return: number of bytes written on success, -1 otherwise.

function.name: gst_element_post_message
function.description: Post a message on the element's #GstBus. This function takes ownership of the message; if you want to access the message after this call, you should add an additional reference before calling.
function.return:
%TRUE if the message was successfully posted. The function returns %FALSE if the element did not have a bus.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_object_unparent
function.description:
Clear the parent of @object, removing the associated reference. This function decreases the refcount of @object.
MT safe. Grabs and releases @object's lock.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_init_from_buffer
function.description:
Initializes a #GstBitReader instance to read from @buffer. This function can be called on already initialized instances.
Since: 0.10.22

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: Buffer from which the #GstBitReader should read

function.name: gst_sdp_media_get_media
function.description: Get the media description of @media.
function.return: the media description.

function.name: gst_rtp_buffer_get_marker
function.description: Check if the marker bit is set on the RTP packet in @buffer.
function.return: TRUE if @buffer has the marker bit set.

function.name: gst_controller_init
function.description: Initializes the use of the controller library. Suggested to be called right after gst_init().

parameter.name: argc
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to the commandline argument count

parameter.name: argv
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to the commandline argument values

function.return: the %TRUE for success.

function.name: gst_query_parse_formats_length
function.description:
Parse the number of formats in the formats @query.
Since: 0.10.4

parameter.name: n_formats
parameter.parameter_description: the number of formats in this query.

function.name: gst_clock_set_master
function.return:
%TRUE if the clock is capable of being slaved to a master clock. Trying to set a master on a clock without the #GST_CLOCK_FLAG_CAN_SET_MASTER flag will make this function return %FALSE.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_poll_wait
function.description:
Wait for activity on the file descriptors in @set. This function waits up to the specified @timeout. A timeout of #GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE waits forever.
When this function is called from multiple threads, -1 will be returned with errno set to EPERM.
function.return:
The number of #GstPollFD in @set that have activity or 0 when no activity was detected after @timeout. If an error occurs, -1 is returned and errno is set.
Since: 0.10.18

function.name: gst_query_parse_seeking
function.description: Parse a seeking query, writing the format into @format, and other results into the passed parameters, if the respective parameters are non-NULL

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: the format to set for the @segment_start and @segment_end values

function.name: gst_netaddress_set_ip4_address
function.description: Set @naddr with the IPv4 @address and @port pair.

function.name: gst_pb_utils_get_source_description
function.description: Returns: a newly-allocated description string, or NULL on error. Free

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.parameter_description: the protocol the source element needs to handle, e.g. "http"

function.return: a newly-allocated description string, or NULL on error. Free string with g_free() when not needed any longer.

function.name: _gst_alloc_trace_register
function.description: Register an get a handle to a GstAllocTrace object that can be used to trace memory allocations.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the new alloc trace object.

function.return: A handle to a GstAllocTrace.

function.name: gst_pad_set_blocked_async_full
function.description:
Blocks or unblocks the dataflow on a pad. The provided callback is called when the operation succeeds; this happens right before the next attempt at pushing a buffer on the pad.
This can take a while as the pad can only become blocked when real dataflow is happening. When the pipeline is stalled, for example in PAUSED, this can take an indeterminate amount of time. You can pass NULL as the callback to make this call block. Be careful with this blocking call as it might not return for reasons stated above.

parameter.name: blocked
parameter.parameter_description: boolean indicating whether the pad should be blocked or unblocked

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: #GstPadBlockCallback that will be called when the operation succeeds

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data passed to the callback

function.return:
TRUE if the pad could be blocked. This function can fail if the wrong parameters were passed or the pad was already in the requested state.
MT safe.
Since: 0.10.23

function.name: gst_bus_timed_pop
function.description:
Get a message from the bus, waiting up to the specified timeout.
If @timeout is 0, this function behaves like gst_bus_pop(). If @timeout is #GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE, this function will block forever until a message was posted on the bus.
function.return:
The #GstMessage that is on the bus after the specified timeout or NULL if the bus is empty after the timeout expired. The message is taken from the bus and needs to be unreffed with gst_message_unref() after usage.
MT safe.
Since: 0.10.12

function.name: gst_bit_reader_peek_bits_uint8
function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val but keep the current position.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #guint8 to store the result

function.return:
%TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.
Since: 0.10.22

function.name: gst_pad_proxy_getcaps
function.description:
Calls gst_pad_get_allowed_caps() for every other pad belonging to the same element as @pad, and returns the intersection of the results.
This function is useful as a default getcaps function for an element that can handle any stream format, but requires all its pads to have the same caps. Two such elements are tee and aggregator.
function.return: the intersection of the other pads' allowed caps.

function.name: gst_fft_f64_fft

parameter.name: timedata
parameter.parameter_description: Buffer of the samples in the time domain

parameter.name: freqdata
parameter.parameter_description: Target buffer for the samples in the frequency domain

function.name: gst_uri_protocol_is_valid
function.description: Tests if the given string is a valid protocol identifier. Protocols must consist of alphanumeric characters, '+', '-' and '.' and must start with a alphabetic character. See RFC 3986 Section 3.1.
function.return: TRUE if the string is a valid protocol identifier, FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_pad_get_pad_template
function.description: Gets the template for @pad.
function.return:
the #GstPadTemplate from which this pad was instantiated, or %NULL if this pad has no template.
FIXME: currently returns an unrefcounted padtemplate.

function.name: gst_plugin_feature_load
function.return: A reference to the loaded feature, or NULL on error.

function.name: gst_query_set_seeking
function.description: Set the seeking query result fields in @query.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: the format to set for the @segment_start and @segment_end values

function.name: gst_pad_set_caps
function.description: Sets the capabilities of this pad. The caps must be fixed. Any previous caps on the pad will be unreffed. This function refs the caps so you should unref if as soon as you don't need it anymore. It is possible to set NULL caps, which will make the pad unnegotiated again.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to set the capabilities of.

function.return:
TRUE if the caps could be set. FALSE if the caps were not fixed or bad parameters were provided to this function.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_rtcp_packet_sdes_next_item
function.description: Move to the next SDES item in @packet.
function.return: TRUE if there was a next item.

function.name: gst_element_factory_can_sink_caps
function.description: Checks if the factory can sink the given capability.
function.return: true if it can sink the capabilities

function.name: gst_pad_query_default
function.description: Invokes the default query handler for the given pad. The query is sent to all pads internally linked to @pad. Note that if there are many possible sink pads that are internally linked to @pad, only one will be sent the query. Multi-sinkpad elements should implement custom query handlers.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to call the default query handler on.

function.return: TRUE if the query was performed succesfully.

function.name: GstObject
function.description: The deep notify signal is used to be notified of property changes. It is typically attached to the toplevel bin to receive notifications from all the elements contained in that bin.

parameter.name: prop_object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that originated the signal

function.name: gst_clock_new_periodic_id
function.description: Get an ID from @clock to trigger a periodic notification. The periodic notifications will start at time @start_time and will then be fired with the given @interval. @id should be unreffed after usage.

parameter.name: clock
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstClockID to get a periodic notification id from

function.return:
A #GstClockID that can be used to request the time notification.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_clock_provide
function.description:
Create a clock provide message. This message is posted whenever an element is ready to provide a clock or lost its ability to provide a clock (maybe because it paused or became EOS).
This message is mainly used internally to manage the clock selection.

parameter.name: ready
parameter.parameter_description: TRUE if the sender can provide a clock

function.return:
The new provide clock message.
MT safe.

function.name: GstTuner
function.description:
Reports that the signal strength has changed.
See Also: gst_tuner_signal_strength()

parameter.name: tuner
parameter.parameter_description: The element providing the GstTuner interface

function.name: gst_collect_pads_add_pad
function.description:
Add a pad to the collection of collect pads. The pad has to be a sinkpad. The refcount of the pad is incremented. Use gst_collect_pads_remove_pad() to remove the pad from the collection again.
You specify a size for the returned #GstCollectData structure so that you can use it to store additional information.
The pad will be automatically activated in push mode when @pads is started.
This function calls gst_collect_pads_add_pad() passing a value of NULL for destroy_notify.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the size of the returned #GstCollectData structure

function.return:
a new #GstCollectData to identify the new pad. Or NULL if wrong parameters are supplied.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_mini_object_make_writable
function.description:
Checks if a mini-object is writable. If not, a writable copy is made and returned. This gives away the reference to the original mini object, and returns a reference to the new object.
MT safe
function.return: a mini-object (possibly the same pointer) that is writable.

function.name: gst_rtsp_url_parse
function.description: Parse the RTSP @urlstr into a newly allocated #GstRTSPUrl. Free after usage with gst_rtsp_url_free().
function.return: a #GstRTSPResult.

function.name: gst_object_restore_thyself
function.description: Restores @object with the data from the parent XML node.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: The XML node to load @object from

function.name: gst_riff_parse_strh
function.description: Parses a strh structure from input data. Takes ownership of @buf.

parameter.name: buf
parameter.parameter_description: input data to be used for parsing, stripped from header.

parameter.name: strh
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer (returned by this function) to a filled-in strh structure. Caller should free it.

function.return: TRUE if parsing succeeded, otherwise FALSE. The stream should be skipped on error, but it is not fatal.

function.name: gst_implements_interface_cast
function.description: cast a given object to an interface type, and check whether this interface is supported for this specific instance.

parameter.name: from
parameter.parameter_description: the object (any sort) from which to cast to the interface

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: the interface type to cast to

function.return: a gpointer to the interface type

function.name: gst_base_audio_src_set_slave_method
function.description:
Controls how clock slaving will be performed in @src.
Since: 0.10.20

function.name: gst_element_found_tags
function.description:
Posts a message to the bus that new tags were found, and pushes an event to all sourcepads. Takes ownership of the @list.
This is a utility method for elements. Applications should use the #GstTagSetter interface.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: element for which we found the tags.

function.name: gst_base_sink_wait_clock
function.description:
This function will block until @time is reached. It is usually called by subclasses that use their own internal synchronisation.
If @time is not valid, no sycnhronisation is done and #GST_CLOCK_BADTIME is returned. Likewise, if synchronisation is disabled in the element or there is no clock, no synchronisation is done and #GST_CLOCK_BADTIME is returned.
This function should only be called with the PREROLL_LOCK held, like when receiving an EOS event in the ::event vmethod or when receiving a buffer in the ::render vmethod.
The @time argument should be the running_time of when this method should return and is not adjusted with any latency or offset configured in the sink.
Since 0.10.20

parameter.name: jitter
parameter.parameter_description: the jitter to be filled with time diff (can be NULL)

function.return: #GstClockReturn

function.name: gst_adapter_available_fast
function.description: Gets the maximum number of bytes that are immediately available without requiring any expensive operations (like copying the data into a temporary buffer).
function.return: number of bytes that are available in @adapter without expensive operations

function.name: gst_poll_new
function.description: Create a new file descriptor set. If @controllable, it is possible to restart or flush a call to gst_poll_wait() with gst_poll_restart() and gst_poll_set_flushing() respectively.

parameter.name: controllable
parameter.parameter_description: whether it should be possible to control a wait.

function.return:
a new #GstPoll, or %NULL in case of an error. Free with gst_poll_free().
Since: 0.10.18

function.name: gst_controller_sync_values
function.description:
Sets the properties of the element, according to the controller that (maybe) handles them and for the given timestamp.
If this function fails, it is most likely the application developers fault. Most probably the control sources are not setup correctly.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the controller that handles the values

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the time that should be processed

function.return: %TRUE if the controller values could be applied to the object properties, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gst_child_proxy_get_child_by_index
function.description: Fetches a child by its number.

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: the parent object to get the child from

parameter.name: index
parameter.parameter_description: the childs position in the child list

function.return:
the child object or %NULL if not found (index too high). Unref after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_sdp_message_emails_len
function.description: Get the number of emails in @msg.
function.return: the number of emails in @msg.

function.name: gst_element_register
function.description: Create a new elementfactory capable of instantiating objects of the @type and add the factory to @plugin.

parameter.name: plugin
parameter.parameter_description: #GstPlugin to register the element with, or NULL for a static element (note that passing NULL only works in GStreamer 0.10.13 and later)

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: name of elements of this type

parameter.name: rank
parameter.parameter_description: rank of element (higher rank means more importance when autoplugging)

function.return: TRUE, if the registering succeeded, FALSE on error

function.name: gst_rtsp_transport_get_mime
function.description: Get the mime type of the transport mode @trans. This mime type is typically used to generate #GstCaps on buffers.
